She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Generosa is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase a variety of curtains and clothing to sell.

In the future, Generosa would like to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and curtains to sell

loans.name: Rashida's Group

texts.en:
Rashida lives in Mian Channu, a small city in the Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 4-room brick house for the past 4 years.

Rashida is recently married and does not yet have children.  She is an active lady who stays at home to perform her duties as a housewife.  Her husband has an animal-selling business. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because many people purchase animals to slaughter.  At other times, he sells his animals to butchers.  Rashida supports her husband by taking care of his animals, giving them timely food and water. 

Rashida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband improve his animal-selling business. With the loan, he will buy a cow and goats to sell to butchers for profit.   Rashida's husband has been doing his business for past 4 years and she hopes that through this loan investment his business will grow further.  

Rashida is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her.
  
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rashida.

loans.use: buy goats and a cow

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 45 years old and married with 4 children.  She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been fattening pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a tricycle business and livestock raising (ducks).  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of 8 children, Felicidad works hard to support her family.  She has a rice and feed retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.  Felicidad is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of feed and rice for her rice and feed retailing business.

Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of feed and rice to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

Amparo has been in this business for 35 years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.  In the future, Amparo would like to do some improvements to her house.

To make a living, Marly owns & operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Marly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marly is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Connie has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store and cafeteria for 10 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (mini-restaurant)/eatery.

Connie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana lives in a 2-room brick house with her family in a city called Mian channu. It is a small city in Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family for past 12 years. Her husband’s name is S. S. and he operates a grocery shop in the market. Through his shop, he offers his clients daily use items such as sugar, salt, cooking oils, etc. He is very good in his dealings with the customers and has good respect amongst them. 

Rukhsana is a caring lady. She performs her duties as a housewife very well. She is a mother of 4 children. All of the children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. This loan will help her husband buy groceries to sell in his grocery shop. He is relatively new in his business; he started his shop only a couple of years ago. Rukhsana hopes that the loan investment will be a good step towards business growth. She is a new loan user and this is her 1st loan application to Asasah. She is hopeful about her family’s better financial future.

loans.use: To buy groceries for shop.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a very supportive lady. Her husband’s name is Q. M. and he operates a grocery shop in the community market. Through his shop, he sells daily use items such as cooking oil, sugar, spices etc. He is very good in his dealings with the clients and offers them different grocery items at very reasonable rates. He has another business of construction supplies which also earns him a reasonable income and helps him in the expenses of running his home. 

Nasreen is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household works. She is the mother of 5 children: four of the children are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to expand his grocery business. Through the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk that will help him in earning better profits. He is new in his business. He started it only two years ago. 

Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will help her husband to grow his business further. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proven herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and by attending every meeting. 
She is a resident of Mian channu, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 14 years.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop.

loans.name: Baasandemberel

texts.en:
Baasandemberel is 25 years old. He lives with his wife and infant daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a small house on his father's plot of land. His parents live in a ger,the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent on same land. 

Baasandemberel has been running a taxi service in the city for the last few years and has gained much experience. Also, he runs a truck tire retail business in his yard. His wife looks after the baby at home. His father and brother-in-law also operate a taxi in the city. Baasandemberel is planning to purchase another second hand car and to build a small wooden house for his parents. He is a very smart and hardworking person with a strong will. The loan he is requesting will be used to get a newer second-hand car in better condition.

loans.use: To get a newer second hand car in better condition.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina lives in Mian channu, a small city in Punjab, Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there for past 17 years with her family in a 2-room brick house. She is 40 years old and married to S. M. who operates a livestock business. He has a cow and a buffalo. He collects the milk by getting up early in the morning everyday and he sells to his community members. He also sells cattle (goats), by raising them as the customers require. 

Robina is a housewife. She stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She takes her responsibilities very seriously and makes the utmost effort to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. In her spare time, she also assists her husband by taking care of his cattle. 

Robina is the mother of a 7 year old daughter who is studying in class 3rd. She also has a 6 year old son who is studying in class 2nd. Robina couldn’t get an education herself due to the poor financial circumstances of her parents. But, she wants to provide a quality education for her children so that they become successful in their lives. 

Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. Through the loan, he will buy cattle (goats) for selling at a profit. He has been doing this business for the past 12 years. Robina hopes that, after the loan investment, her husband’s business will be in a more profitable position and it will result in a better financial condition for her family.

loans.use: To buy cattle (goats) for selling.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok Y., age 58, has been cultivating rice crops on her own farmland for over ten years, in the province of Kompong Chhnang. Her husband earns a daily income by working on a fruit plantation. The couple usually generates a profit about $3.50 per day. They have given birth to seven children, all married now and most of them living separately.

Sok Y. says she is worried about the water system in her house. She always goes to her neighbor’s house when she needs to use water. It is not easy for her and her family to access water. Therefore, Sok Y. would like a loan to dig a well for her family's use. This loan will improve her living standard and make her family’s situation better. She dreams of opening a new grocery store.

loans.use: to dig a well for her family's use

loans.name: Undarmaa

texts.en:
Undarmaa is 29 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in a small wooden house on her plot of land. Her children, ages 6 to 11, are all attending the local secondary school. 

She and her husband have been running a furniture making business since 2006. They buy materials such as plywood, planks, glue and wood processing equipments to make different household furniture for apartments and gers (a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). Undarmaa sells the furnitures at “Narantuul”, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar city. 

She was telling us that her business was struggling when they first started, but now they have their own customers from whom they receive enough orders to make a furniture. Her dream is to give her children a good education and teach them good morals. At the moment she is planning to expand her business by buying new wood processing equipments such as lathe and carving machine.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying new  lathe and wood carving machine.

loans.name: Fiorella Victoria

texts.es: Fiorella tiene 26 años de edad y es casada. Vive junto a su esposo en la casa de sus suegros en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana su vida como empleado en una botica en su comunidad. Tiene dos años de experiencia en este rubro. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos en su domicilio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Fiorella es muy trabajadora y responsable. Posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 26 years old and married.  She lives with her husband in her in-laws' home which is in Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Fiorella earns a living as an employee in a drugstore in her community.  She has two years experience in this line of work.  Fiorella's house is currently in a bad state of repair.  She would like to make some repairs to her home in order to improve her family's quality of life.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Fiorella is very hard working and responsible.  She has good personal and work references from her community.  She has had previous loans and paid them all back on time.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nets for traditional, small-scale fishing

loans.name: Lucia Betti

texts.es: Lucia tiene 55 años D. edad y es casada con M. Alvarado José Rómulo (mostrado en la foto con ella). Ellos tienen hijos ya independientes. Viven en casa propia en un vecindario del distrito D. Tumán, una comunidad humilD. pero que si cuenta con servicio D. agua potable y electricidad. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos a su domicilio para mejorar sus condiciones D. vida. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles. Con este crédito, Lucia no tendrá que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento familiar. Agradece a los prestamistas D. Kiva por su apoyo en mejorar su calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Lucia is 55 years old and married to M. Alvarado José Rómulo (who is shown in the photo with her).  They have children who already live independently.  Lucia and her husband live in their own home in a neighborhood of Tumán district.  It is a humble community but they do have access to drinking water and electricity.

Lucia's home is currently in a bad state of repair.  She would like to make some repairs to her home in order to improve her living conditions.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

This loan means that Lucia will not have to turn to informal lenders who would charge her very high interest rates which would have a negative impact on her daily cash flow and hold up her family's growth.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support in improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Chochope en el norte de Perú. Desde hace 4 años, ella cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Hilaria es muy conocida en el mercado y tiene clientela ya establecida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Con esta inversión, podrá incrementar sus inventarios y tener mejores ventas. Hilaria posee buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad urbana. Es muy responsable. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Hilaria is 34 years old, married, and has two dependent children.  She lives in her own home, in Chochope district, in the north of Peru.

For four years, Hilaria has owned a small grocery store which is located in her home.  There she offers her neighbors and local customers a range of staple products, including essentials and groceries.  Hilaria is very well known in the market and has an established customer base.  She would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this investment, she will be able to increase her inventory and make more sales.

Hilaria has good personal and work references from her urban community.  She is very responsible.  She has received previous loans and paid them back on time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Segundo Nicanor

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 47 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Se gana la vida desde criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados cerca de su domicilio. Suele criar ganado porcino, ovino, caprino y aves de corral. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Segundo desea aumentar su negocio con la compra de más animales para engorde y en alimento balanceado. Por ello, solicita un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Segundo is 47 years old and he is single. He lives in a house that is his own in a rural area of the district of Olmos. It is an agricultural region with a great deal of commercial activity. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than one hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He does not have basic services, such as water and hydro. 

He earns a living by raising and selling small livestock from corrals located near his home. He raises pigs, sheep, goats, and poultry. When the livestock have reached a good level in their development he offers them for sale to the merchants who visit the region where he lives. He learned this business from his parents, meaning he knows this business perfectly. Segundo wants to increase his business with the purchase of more livestock to fatten and to purchase balanced feed. For this reason he requests a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced feed

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn S. E. is a 30-year-old woman who has been in the farming business for many years. She always grows rice crops on her existing farm to earn a profit. She has a life partner in her husband who earns money by climbing palm trees around his community in Kompong Chhnang province. They have two children who are still single and living under their roof. 

She will use the $500 loan to purchase a used motorbike for traveling to anywhere without hiring a motor taxi and to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a used motorbike for traveling without hiring a motor taxi and to repair her house.

loans.name: Erick De Los Santos

texts.es:
Erick  tiene 29 años de edad y es casada. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Erick gana la vida brindando servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Adicionalmente, para generar ingresos adicionales, se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales. Guarda sus animales en unos corrales ubicados cerca de su casa. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Erick desea aumentar su ganado con la compra de más animales y alimenta balanceado. También desea usar una parte de su préstamo para arreglar y mantener su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Con sus ingresos, puede seguir ayudando a su esposo con los gastos familiares. También, espera seguir creciendo su negocio para poder comprar una mototaxi más que pueda alquilar a otros mototaxistas.
texts.en:
Erick is 29 years old, married, and she lives in a house of her own together with her husband.  It is located in the district of Olmos, an agricultural zone with significant commercial activity. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than one hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Erick earns a living by providing public transport services to passengers on her motorcycle rickshaw. It is a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a cabin used to transport passengers inside. IN order to generate an additional income she also raises and sells livestock. She keeps her livestock in corrals located near her house. When they have reached a certain level in their development she offers them for sale to the merchants who visit the region where they live.  Erick wants to increase her herd by purchasing more livestock and by purchasing balanced feed.  She also wants to use a part of her loan to carry out maintenance and repairs to her motorcycle rickshaw. She needs to maintain her vehicle in good condition to be able to keep offering her clients a good level of service. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles. With her earnings she will be able to keep helping her husband with the family's expenses. She also wants to keep expanding her business and to be able to purchase another motorcycle rickshaw to rent out to other drivers.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance and repairs to her rickshaw

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 32 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Vive en casa propia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como ovejas chivos, chanchos y aves de corral. Guarda los animales en corrales ubicados en un terreno cerca de su casa. Santiago compra los animales en los anexos de la zona para luego engordarlos y venderlos en la ciudad de Olmos o enviarlos a la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años en este rubro. Desea ampliar su ganado con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Espera poder incrementar sus ventas para generar mayores ingresos. Con sus ingresos,  desea hacer unos arreglos a su casa. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Santiago is 32 years old, married, with 4 young children.  He lives in his own home in the Olmos district, a very busy commercial and agricultural area; Olmos is located in the Lambayeque province about an hour and a half from Chiclayo.  Currently, Santiago does not have water and electricity in his home.

He works raising and selling small animals like sheep, pigs, and chickens.  He keeps the animals in pens and coops on some land close to his home.  He buys the animals on the outskirts of the city and then takes the time to fatten them up and sell them in Olmos or send them to Chiclayo for sale.  He has worked in this business for 5 years.  He would like to expand his business by buying more animals and well-balanced animal feed.  In order to do so, he is requesting a $725 loan from Edpyme Alternative.  He hopes to increase his sales to improve his income.  He will use his increased income to fix his home.  He dreams of providing a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock and well-balanced feed.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos tiene 39 años de edad y es soltero sin hijos. Vive en casa familiar con su hermana y madre, en un humilde vecindario del distrito de Tumán en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida trabajando como obrero en una empresa donde cosecha y procesa caña de azúcar. Lleva un año en este empleo. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos y tambien comprar muebles para el hogar. Se proyecta a darle mayores comodidades a su casa. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles. Este préstamo permitirá que Santos trabaje más tranquilo sin tener que recurrir a prestamistas informales que le cobrarían tasas altísimas, lo cual perjudica su liquidez diaria y retrasa su crecimiento familiar. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Santos is 39 years old and is single with no children.  He lives in his family's house with his sister and mother in a humble neighborhood in the Tuman district in the north of Peru.  He earns a living working in a business that harvests and processes sugar cane.  He has worked for one year in this business.  Currently, his home is in a somewhat deteriorated condition.  He would like to make some improvements to the home and buy some furniture.  He would like to make his home more comfortable.  In order to do so, he is requesting a $200 loan from Edpyme Alternative.  This loan will allow Santos to work more comfortably without having to go to informal lenders that would charge him very high rates.  Such lenders make it difficult for Santos to get ahead and improve life for his family.  He is grateful to the lenders from Kiva who are helping him improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home and buy furniture.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
Blanca Flor tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Actualmente, no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como ovejas chivos, chanchos y aves de corral. Guarda los animales en corrales ubicados en un terreno cerca de su casa. Blanca Flor compra los animales en los anexos de la zona para luego engordarlos y venderlos en la ciudad de Motupe. Cuenta con una experiencia de 6 años en este rubro. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce el rubor a la perfección. Desea ampliar su ganado con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Espera poder incrementar sus ventas para generar mayores ingresos que puede usar para solventar sus gastos familiares. Quiere seguir creciendo su negocio para lograr su mayor anhelo: ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Blanca Flor is 25 years old and a single mother of one son.  She lives in her own home in a rural area of the district of Motupe, an agricultural area in the Lambayeque province, approximately an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.  Currently, her home does not have running water or electricity.

She works raising and selling small animals like sheep, pigs, and chickens.  She keeps the animals in pens and coops on some land close to her home.  Blanca Flor buys the animals in the outskirts of the city and then fattens them up and sells them in the city of Motupe.  She has worked in this business for the past 6 years.  She learned this trade from her father so she has understood the work from her youth.  She would like to expand her business and buy more animals and well-balanced animal feed.  She has requested a $375 loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  She hopes to increase her sales and increase her income to cover her family expenses.  She would like to keep building her business to achieve her dream: offer a better of quality of life for her son.

loans.use: to buy more livestock and well-balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Lindaura

texts.es: Lindaura tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia dentro del distrito de Chiclayo en un vecindario humilde. Su comunidad es urbana y está en vías de crecimiento. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de panca, la hoja que cubre choclo, por las mañanas todos los días dentro de su misma comunidad. Durante las tardes, ella brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Con estas actividades, puede ayudar a su esposo solventar los gastos familiares. Con parte de su préstamo desea aumentar sus ventas de panca con la compra de más mercadería. Pretende usar la otra parte para hacer arreglar y mantener su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lindaura, 36, is married and has two minor children.  She lives with her family in her own house in Chiclayo District in a very humble neighborhood.  Her community is urban and undergoing growth.  For the last two years she’s been selling “panca,” corn husks, every day during the morning in her own community.  During the afternoon she provides public transportation services with her mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to move people from place to place.  With these activities she’s able to help her husband cover family expenses.

She will use part of the loan to increase her corn husk sales with the purchase of more merchandise.  She also needs to maintain her vehicle in good working order to continue providing good customer service.  Because of this, she has deemed it proper to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to repair her mototaxi and to buy more corn husks to sell.

loans.name: Jonhy Richar

texts.es: Johny es padre de casa de 30 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos en casa familiar en la zona rural del distrito de Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Desde hace siete años, se dedica a la venta de frutas al por mayor. Cuento con un puesto cerca del Mercado San Pedro donde vende sus productos todos los días. Actualmente, una nueva temporada escolar ha comenzado en Perú y Edpyme Alternativa  les ofrece a sus clientes la posibilidad de solicitar un préstamo para solventar gastos escolares.  Por ello, Johny ha acudido a la institución para solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles lo cual ayudará a pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos menores y comprarles útiles escolares. Johny es muy trabajador y responsable. Ha manejado otros préstamos y los canceló de manera puntual. Johny es bastante entregado a su familia y labora siempre para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Johny is the father of the house and is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in their home in the rural district of Pacasmayo, an area with significant commercial movement that is located in the La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. For the past seven years, he has worked in wholesale selling fruit. He has a stand near the Mercado San Pedro where he sells his products every day. The school season has begun in Peru and Edpyme Alternativa offers its clients the possibility of asking for a loan to pay school expenses. Because of this, Johny has approached the institution to ask for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles which will help him to pay the school expenses of his younger children and purchase school supplies. Johny is a hard worker and responsible. He has had other loans and has paid them punctually. Johny is very involved with his family and alweays works to help them get ahead.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses for his two young children

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Cultivating rice is the most popular occupation in Cambodia. Hok S. is one of the people who earns a living by growing rice crops. She and her husband have spent most of their life doing this. They typically make an income averaging $6 each day to use for the family’s needs. Hok S. has two single kids, both of whom are students in a local school. 

In order to support her in the planting-crop business, Hok S. is applying for a loan from Kiva in order to buy a plowing machine to plow her farmland so she can start preparing her dry-season rice field.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is single and has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of items to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Violeta would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items to sell

loans.name: Felecidad

texts.en:
Felecidad is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Felecidad is 40 years old.

Felecidad has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Felecidad requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Felecidad has been in this business for nine years.  In the future, Felecidad would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Christine is 42 years old 

Christine has a RTW (clothing) business in the Philippines. Christine requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional clothes to sell.

Christine has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Christine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en: Zosima is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zosima is 60 years old. She has a charcoal sales business in the Philippines. Zosima has been in this business for 15 years. Zosima requested a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. In the future, Zosima would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 41 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemary is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase vitamins and feed for her pigs.

Rosemary has been raising pigs for 10 years.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase vitamins and feed for pigs

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 25 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Victoria has been raising pigs for six years. She is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Victoria is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for pigs.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 39 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Elvira has been in this business for nine years and she also earns additional income as a food vendor. Elvira is borrowing 13,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream – to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ailyn is 33 years old. 

Ailyn has a buying and selling of bananas business in the Philippines. Ailyn requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruit to sell in her fruit stand.

Ailyn has been in this business for 14 years.  In the future, Ailyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fruit to sell in her fruit stand

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 46 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general (sari- sari) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc., in her general (sari-sari) store.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general (sari-sari) store for six years and also earns an income from selling rice. Alicia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Neb

texts.en:
Neb L. earns a living by selling a few fresh fish in the local market in Siem Reap province. She is a 41-year-old widow woman who currently lives with two single children who are still attending the local school. 

Neb L. will use her loan in order to buy additional fresh fish for resale. Neb L. believes she can increase her daily income by using this Kiva loan as an advance.

loans.use: To buy additional fresh fish for resale.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine, age 30, is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Geraldine has a manicure / pedicure business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Geraldine requested a 16,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy new tools for her manicure / pedicure business. In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her manicure/pedicure business,

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maisha Zhakem Group

texts.en:
Mariam J. is in her late thirties.  She is married with two children.  She has a business of selling cold drinks, like water, juice, sodas and milk. She has been in this business since 2010 and works from 7.00am to 8.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the stock of her cold drinks and has successfully paid back her loans.  She hopes for a loan to buy a refrigerator to improve on her business sales. Her dream is to one day open a wholesale shop for selling the same products.

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Maisha Zhakem" which has a total of 21 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Mariam is 1st on the right with a purple skirt.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo S. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. He is 50 years old. Raymundo is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing motorela (or habal-habal) services to local community members. He also buys and sells bananas and coconuts. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $300 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Raymundo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase some tools needed to provide his service.

Raymundo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more tools needed for the maintenance of his service. This will be his 4th loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more tools needed for the maintenance of his service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy all the additional supplies she needs in her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 46 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are in school. Amalia is in the business of culturing oysters in the Philippines. Amalia has been in this business for 27 years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase bamboo and net for her oyster culture. In the future, Amalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo and net for culturing oysters.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
As a married parent with eight children, Anafe works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from renting dresses. Anafe is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to buy more textiles for her tailoring business.

Anafe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream – to repair and renovate her home and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more textiles for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Kisukuru Group

texts.en:
Safia Y. is in her mid-forties.  She has four children who are still in school.  She has operated a general store business for one year.  She works from 6.30am to 9.30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Safia's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes to increase on the shop inventory. Her dream is to one day build another house, as she has one already.

Safia will share this loan with her loan group "Kisukuru", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Safia is in the middle of the front row.

loans.use: to increase on the shop inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more land and good quality seed

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a married woman with eight children. Five of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cresencia is 52 years old.

Cresencia has a vegetables and spice vending business in the Philippines. Cresencia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Cresencia has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 40 years old, married and living in Baclayon, Bohol. She has a 9-year-old child. 

Annabel runs a tricycle (motorcycle with a passenger cab) business and has had this business for nine years. Her husband is the driver of the tricycle. Annabel also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Annabel is asking for a loan to purchase tricycle spare parts and pig feed. This will help Annabel continue her tricycle business and keep the pigs healthy.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle spare parts and pig feed

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
Deogracia is 46 years old and married with three children.  Deogracia works very hard to provide for them.

Deogracia runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Deogracia has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. 

In the future, Deogracia would like to repair and renovate her home.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ammabel

texts.en: Ammabel is 39 years old and married with three children in school. Ammabel works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store. Ammabel has been in her business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as curls, shampoo, soap, candy and other miscellaneous items. In the future, Ammabel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase equipment and tools for his shop and also to hire a student

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania, 57 years old, is married with 7 children, 2 of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Epifania has operated a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines for 1 year. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment and tools. In the future, Epifania would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables for his shop

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Rebecca is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a general store, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She also sells fish like sardines and milk fish. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Analyn works hard to support her family. She has a handicrafts (shells) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional shells for her business.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional shells for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita, 28 years old, is married with 4 children, 3 of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anecita has operated a business buying and selling  used clothes for 7 years. Anecita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes for her business. In the future, Anecita would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally B. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 39 years old. Sally is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Sally sells coconuts and green bananas in the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sally joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Sally has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Sally is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green bananas and coconuts. This will be the second loan taken out by Sally from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional green bananas and coconuts

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Elena has operated a general store in the Philippines for 30 years and also earns income from vegetable sales. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, sardines, groceries, and other items to sell in her general store.

Elena has previously borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her store

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Lina works hard to support her family. She has a home products sales business in the Philippines. Lina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional home product items for her business.

Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional home products to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is married and she works hard to support her family. Gladys has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 3 years. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase chicken, hotdogs, pork, etc. for her food vending business. In the future, Gladys would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase meat for her food vending business

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is married and she works hard to support her family. She has operated a business buying and selling used clothes for 20 years. Imelda has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy bundles of used clothes for her business. In the future, Imelda would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 59 years old and married with 6 children, one of whom attends school. Maria works very hard to provide for her family. Maria has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines for 8 years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, bread, candies, biscuits, etc. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell. In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory

loans.name: Jimly

texts.en:
Jimly is 37 years old and married with three children.

Jimly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like juices, soap, groceries, etc in her sari-sari store.

Jimly has borrowed and paid back 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from services (ID lamination).

Jimly aspires to repair and renovate her family home and to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with six children. Three of the children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 49 years old. 

Teresita has a buying and selling of home products business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more home products to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 22 years.  In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca O., from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental, is 50 years old and married. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop that sells canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and biscuits to the local community. In business for over three years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase more products such as instant noodles and snack foods, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like instant noodles and snack foods

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 43 years old and married with four children.

Juvy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sardines, oil, groceries, etc to sell in her sari-sari store.

Juvy has borrowed and paid back 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years and also earns an income from a coffee shop.

Juvy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo S. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. He is 46 years old. Romeo is married and has nine school-aged children. 

To make a living, Romeo sells bananas and coconuts for copras (dried coconut meat used in oil production). Romeo has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Romeo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Romeo is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This will be the first loan taken out by Romeo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
