Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Mariée, âgée de 44ans, Jacqueline a 3enfants dont l’âge varie de 5 à 13ans.
Elle débute dans la petite pâtisserie  en 2000 avec un capital de 10.000F et avec les ristournes, elle s’accroche dans cette activité.
Elle faits des beignets devant son domicile du matin au soir. Ses ventes journalières  sont comprises entre 15.000F et 25.000F.
Avec le prêt qu’elle va avoir, elle va augmenter son stock  de farine, d’huile, de la levure, de sucre, de bois de chauffe et des lots de sachets emballage.
Très silencieuse et gentille, son activité va prospérer et elle compte augmenter ses revenus en améliorant la qualité de ses beignets.
Comme ses enfants sont vont encore à l’école, elle continue à subvenir à leurs besoins en les soutenant scolairement.
texts.en: Jacqueline is 44 years old, married, with three children, between 5 and 13 years of age. She started a small bakery business in 2000, with a starting capital of 10,000 West African Francs, and with the income, she was able to develop her business. She cooks beignets in front of her home, from morning to night. Her daily receipts are between 15,000 and 25,000 francs. With her loan she would like to stock up on flour, oil, yeast, sugar, heating wood and bags for packaging. Very quiet and kind, she keeps expanding her business and plans to raise her revenues by enhancing the quality of her beignets. As her children still go to school, she continues to provide for their needs and support their education.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, yeast, sugar, heating wood and bags for packaging.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma R. is from the village of Talisayan, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Norma is married and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Norma owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, detergents, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Norma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like snack foods and canned goods. This will be the third loan taken out by Norma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like snack foods and canned goods

loans.name: Ma. Juna

texts.en:
Ma. Juna B. is 40 years old, married and living in Baclayon, Bohol. She has two children aged 9 and 5.  Her husband works as a driver.

Ma. Juna sells barbecue to the people in her community. She marinates pork and chicken meat in the morning and grills it in the afternoon. Ma. Juna also makes key chains and coin purses that she sells to her community as well.

Ma. Juna has requested a loan to purchase pork and chicken meat, soy sauce and other ingredients for barbecue. She hopes for her barbecue business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase pork and chicken meat, soy sauce and other ingredients for barbecue

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita A. is from the village of Damayuhan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 67 years old. Pacita is widowed and has 10 adult children. 

To make a living, Pacita buys and sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (coconut meat used in oil production) in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Pacita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Pacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Enkhtur

texts.en:
Enkhtur B. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Erdenet, the second biggest city of Mongolia. They all live together in a wooden house, which he built recently. His older daughter attends a local secondary school and the younger son attends kindergarten.

Enkhtur has operated an auto repair service and a tire repair service for the last three years. He has gained much experience. He has a small garage. The garage is currently unsuitable for working in cold weather. He is planning to make it warm by putting some insulation into the walls and  fitting a local heating system. 

Enkhtur is a very optimistic person and he has been working hard to achieve. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy insulation and building materials to finish his house and to complete the garage.

loans.use: to buy building materials to finish his house and winterize his auto service garage

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida F., from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental, is 72 years old, widowed, and has four grown children. To make a living, Zenaida owns and operates a business that makes and sells snacks and other delicacies such as rice and cheese cakes to the local community. Engaged in her business for over 10 years, she earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 4000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed such as flour and eggs, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed such as flour and eggs

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a four-room brick house with her family for the past 10 years. 

She is a housewife and takes care of her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very good mother who is rearing her children very well. Both of her sons are very young and are not of school-age yet.  

Her husband’s name is R., and he runs two businesses. He is a driver and provides transport services to passengers and also operates a dairy business. He gets milk from his buffaloes and sells to community clients.  

Shahida is a very active lady and operates the milk-selling business in the absence of her husband.  
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy another buffalo for the dairy business. This will help her husband to produce more milk and increase sales. 

Milk-selling is Shahida’s family business and they have been doing it for past 10 years. She is hopeful that an investment will help them improve their business further. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan experience with Asasah.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Celine

texts.fr:
A 35ans d’âge, Céline est mariée, mère de 2enfantsdont l’âge varie entre  3 ans et 7ans, avec son niveau bac, elle se lance dans la vente des poissons d’eau douce depuis 8ans et cela l’intéresse.

Elle s’approvisionne en poissons au port des piroguiers et attends les camions en provenance  du nord, elle achète en gros  et revends en détails au marché. Ses ventes journalières sont de 150.000F
Avec le prêt qu’elle aura, elle va augmenter son stock de poisson en achetant :
1bac d’anguilles, 1 bac de silures, bac de carpes.
Comme toute vendeuse ambitieuse,  elle compte continuer avec HOPE -CONGO, faire plus de revenus,  épargner plus  afin de contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Céline is 35 years old, married and mother to two children who are three and seven years old. Having reached baccalaureate level at school, she set herself up selling fresh water fish eight years ago, an activity which interests her.

She gets her supplies of fish at the canoe port, waiting for the lorries to come from the north. She buys wholesale and resells on a retail basis at the market. Her daily turnover is 150,000 francs. 

With the loan she receives she will increase her supply of fish by buying: one tub of eels, one tub of brown bullheads and one tub of carp. Like all ambitious salespeople she is hoping to continue working with Hope Congo, make more money and save more in order to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase tubs of brown bullhead fish, eels and carps

loans.name: Yunia

texts.en:
Yunia A. is 50 years old, widowed and a mother of seven children who are all adults. She has been selling clothes in Rongo town for 10 years and earns a profit margin of KES. 15,000. 


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend, and she is applying for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to buy more clothes for sale. Yunia plans to use the anticipated profit to repay the KADET LTD loan. 


Yunia hopes to grow her business and, in the future, to open a wholesale store for clothes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Médiatrice

texts.fr:
Médiatrice est âgée de 22ans, divorcée, mère d’enfants dont l’âge varie de 16 à 19ans avec son niveau 3em.

Elle débute en 2001 avec un capital de30.000F et devient vendeuse  de poisson de mer  au marché tel que dorades, soles, bars, capitaine, carpes, barbillons.
Ses ventes journalières sont de 12.000F et  il y a des jours ou elle vend 25000F.
Avec le prêt, elle va renforcer son stock de vente en achetant : 2cartons de bars, 1carton de soles, 1carton carpes, 1carton de dorades, barbillons.
Avec ce stock pour un début, elle voudrait  renforcer ses économies pour atteindre ses objectifs :
 Construire une maison pour le bien être de sa famille et aider ses enfants  à avoir un emploi après leurs formations universitaires.
texts.en:
Médiatrice is 22 years old, divorced and mother to children aged between 16 and 19 years old. She left school in third grade (of the Congolese education system). She began in 2001, with a capital of 30,000 francs, to sell seawater fish, such as sea bream, sole, sea-bass, "Capitaine" fish and barbel at the market. Her daily turnover is 12,000 francs and there are days when she has sales of 25,000 francs.

With the loan she is going to build up her stock by buying: two boxes of sea-bass, one box of carp, one box of sea bream and barbel. With this stock she would like to start off by strengthening her savings in order to achieve her objectives: building a house for her family and helping her children to get jobs after their university studies.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of sea-bass, sole, carp, sea bream and barbel

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. is a 59-year-old from Kisumu city, who is married and has no children.

Jane has a business of selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for the past five years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock.  

Jane is optimistic that her business will do well after she gets the money as she currently earns a profit of KES. 10,000. The profits made will go to supporting her nephews by paying school fees for them.

She hopes to be able to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan works hard to support her family. Susan is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Susan requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy a new engine for her pump boat.

Susan has been in this business for a year and earns an additional income from her tricycle transport business.

In the future, Susan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for her pumpboat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old.  She is married and has 1 child. Letecia works very hard to provide for her family.   To make a living, she runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  Letecia has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Letecia has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, curls, oil, etc.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mary Seller

texts.en:
Mary is married to Chinto and they have two children. She has been running a hotel business for two years and makes an income of Kshs 10,000 in a month.

Mary was introduced to KADET LTD by existing clients and is applying for her third loan, which she plans to use to purchase more food supplies, such as sugar, flour and cooking fat. She plans to use the profits to educate her children and improve her family's living standards.

Mary describes herself as hard-working.

loans.use: to purchase food for her hotel business

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 39 years old.  She is married and has 7 children.   Marites works hard to provide for her family.  To make a living, she runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  Marites has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase biscuits, soaps, and grocery items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Marites has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns income from selling rice.

Marites aspires to build and expand her business in order to secure her family's future.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
As a married parent of 1 child, Melva works hard to support her family.  She has a transportation (tricycle) business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming and selling ice cream.  Melva is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her transportation (tricycle) business.

Melva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 59 years old.  She is a widow with 8 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nenita has been raising pigs  for 7 years.  She also earns additional income from selling Avon products and from her general store.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of repairing and renovating her family home.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 47 years old.  She is married and has 6 children.  Pacita works hard to provide for her family.  To earn income, Pacita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.    She has been running her sari-sari store for the past 3 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

Pacita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase shampoos and grocery items to sell in her sari-sari store.  Pacita has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. 

Pacita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for her general store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 51 years old.  She is married and has 1 child.   She earns a living by raising and selling pigs. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Rebecca has been raising pigs for 20 years.  She also earns additional income from food vending (banana cue).  

Rebecca is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is 56 years old.  She is married and has 5 children. 

Sergia is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She  has a used clothes trading business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 34 years.  Sergia has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bundles of used clothing to sell.

In the future, Sergia  would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Elza

texts.ru:
Elza A. 41 qod. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje. Elza yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoim mujem i lubimimi detmi. Elza uje 5 let zanimayetsya vipechkoy xleba "Tandir".
 Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit ustanovku dlya vitajki dimaxoda i vipechki xleba. Tak kak ona rabotayet v pomesheniye yey nujna ustanovit vitajku.
texts.en:
Elza A. is 41 years old. She is married and has two children, who are in college. She is an Internally Displaced Person from the town of Fuzuli, now living in the Absheron Region with her husband and beloved children. She has been baking traditional “tandir” bread for five years.

At present she needs 2300 AZN in order to buy equipment for venting her stove and baking bread. Since she works indoors, she really needs to have a vent installed.

loans.use: to purchase a vent for her stove used to bake bread

loans.name: Jimalyn

texts.en:
Jimalyn works hard to support her family.  She is single and has an E-loading business in the Philippines.

Jimalyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy LoadWallet (pre-paid air time service) for her E-loading business.

Jimalyn has been in this business for the past 2 years.  In the future, Jimalyn would like to open another business.

loans.use: To purchase air time for her E-loading business

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 52 years old.  She is married and has 5 children.  With 3 children in school, Ma. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Victoria runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, soap and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.   Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, oil, etc.

In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items for her general store

loans.name: Djiguitougou  (Espoir) Group

texts.fr:
Djiguitougou est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien et qui vivent ensemble dans le même quartier, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 5  enfants.
Les membres de ce groupe Djiguitougou fait l’achat et la vente de plusieurs produits alimentaires et des condiments alimentaires.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. 
Nana C.  qui est un des membres fait l’achat et la vente des condiments   de toutes sortes (huile, oignon, Sounbala, tomates, cubes magies, ail, épices etc.) Elle est très sollicitée car elle occupe une bonne place au cœur du marché de Hamdallaye sous un hangar.
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une importante quantité de condiments au  grand marché de Koutiala en gros pour les  revendre en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée essentiellement  de femmes.
Tandis que Les autres membres du groupe Djiguitougou comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 135 000FCFA chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Nana C., elle,  compte réaliser 140 000 FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier  leurs activités.
texts.en:
Djiguitougou is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of the town of Koutiala. They know each other well and live together in the same neighborhood in large traditional families with their husbands, children and co-wives. They average 36 years of age, are married and mother to at least five children each. 

The members of the Djiguitougou group buy and sell various food products as well as condiments. In order to expand their businesses, they decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago.

Nana C. is one of the group members who buys and sells all types of condiments (oil, onions, sounbala, tomatoes, Maggie stock cubes, garlic and spices etc.). She is in great demand because she has a good position under a hangar right in the heart of the market in Hamdallaye. She is planning to use her loan to buy a significant quantity of condiments at the large market in Koutiala on a wholesale basis, and then sell them on a retail basis for cash to a customer base made up mainly of women. 

While the other members of the Djiguitougou group are expecting to make an average profit of 135,000FCFA each during the course of this cycle, Nana C. is expecting to make 140,000FCFA. 

As well as paying back their loans, they are going to use part of the income to cover their families' running costs. They would like to strengthen this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to diversify their activities.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela A. is 36 years old, married and has six children who are between the ages of 22 years and 10 years old. 

Pamela has a business of selling second-hand clothes and has been in this business for the past three years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more clothes to add to her stock. 

She is optimistic that her business will do well after she gets the money as she currently earns a profit of KES. 20,000, which goes to pay school fees for her children and catering to her family’s needs.

She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase good quality seed and tools he needs for his land.

loans.name: Jacinta Akinyi

texts.en:
Jacinta is 26 years old and comes from Kisumu city. She is a single mother of one child. She currently lives with her sister's daughter whom she also supports.

Jacinta has a business selling grocery items such as vegetables, onions, tomatoes, etc. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to be able to increase her stock. She is optimistic that the loan will help boost her business and she will see it expand as a result of the profits made. 


Jacinta will use the extra profits to pay school fees for her child and cater for her family's needs. She hopes to be able to open up a stall to supply fruit and vegetables wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,  other vegetables, and onions.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry Odera N. is 30 years old and married to Tabitha who is a business lady. He supports four people. Henry runs a motorcycle transport business in Nyatike, Migori town. He has been in this business for 16 years and earns a good income.     


He learned about KADET LTD through a friend, and he has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan amount to buy another motorbike for the business.              


Henry intends to use the anticipated profit to save and pay school fees for his children.  In future he plans to grow his business and be able to manage many motorbikes for hire.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is married to I. A. who operates a grocery store in the community market and also works as a farmer and grows cotton, wheat and other seasonal crops. Razia herself is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and do her household responsibilities. She has given birth to two sons. Both of them are very young and are not of school-going age. Her youngest son is only three months old and requires the full attention of his mother. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help her husband who wants to improve his grocery store business. Through the loan, he will put more groceries into his grocery store to fulfill the needs of his customers and to earn better profits. Razia is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to him and upgrade her family’s living standard. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She is a responsible client and pays her installments on time. She belongs to Mian Channu which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture. Her house contains four rooms and she has been living in it with her family for the past seven years.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is married to Susan and they have three children. He has been running a retail shop as a primary business for 11 years. He also has been selling vegetables for 11 years and gets a monthly income of KES. 9,000.

Dominic was introduced to KADET LTD by existing customers and currently he is servicing his eighth loan after repaying the previous ones successfully. He plans to use the loan amount to purchase more stock like sugar, flour and cakes for the retail shop for sale.

Dominic hopes to expand his business and build a better house for his family. He describes himself as hard-working.

loans.use: To buy more stock such as sugar, flour, and cakes.

loans.name: Tonkolili Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tonkolili” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isata S. is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a diamond miner and they have four children – three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Isata has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells “lafidi” (cooked rice). With her share of this loan, she will buy palm oil, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. in order to improve her business size and quality.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, Maggi cubes, onions, etc. in order to improve her business size and quality.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy sugar, milk, butter, soap, etc. in large quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Talib

texts.en:
H. Talib is married and has three children. He is a master woodworker, engaged in manufacturing windows and doors. Talib is the owner of his business and he began his business manufacturing boxes. His wife and sons help him in his business. He purchases lumber from Tursunzade city. Talib would like to get a loan of 4500 Somoni to purchase lumber to dry. Then after a month he manufactures windows and doors.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Sanobarkhon

texts.en:
I. Sanobarkhon is a widow who lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She lives with her two children, and that’s why she needs a normal income which can ensure her children of everything they may need. She started her activities in the business of trading industrial goods. Today she sells fabrics in the market of Sakhovat. She has been in this business for 11 years. 

Sanobarkhon would like to get a loan of 7000 Somoni for purchasing new modern fabrics.  She thanks all lenders who enable her to ensure her children’s needs are covered and improve their lives.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Sorbeh” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Posseh B.. Posseh was born in the northern city of Makeni 40 years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Posseh has been selling palm oil, rice, groundnuts, etc., and has been running this businessman for two years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice, groundnuts, etc., in large quantity.

loans.name: Mukaramakhon

texts.en:
K. Mukaramakhon lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Mukaramakhon began her business by selling fabrics, and she has been in this business for 12 years. She sells her goods in the market of Sakhovat in Tursunzade City. She purchases her goods from Dushanbe Korvon market four or five times in a month. Mukaramakhon would like to get a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase new fashionable fabrics to increase her working capital. She thanks all lenders who support her and allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
M. Mavluda is a divorced woman. She is the loving mother of two children. She works at her home, and she takes care of her family. Her children are growing day by day, and expenses are also increasing. She sells skullcaps at the market of Dehqon. She has been in this business for a year. Before, she sold gold jewelry. Mavluda imports her goods from Andijom City in the Republic of Uzbekistan. Mavluda would like to get a loan of $1,000 US for purchasing new skullcaps and expanding her business.

loans.name: Marguba

texts.en:
P. Marguba lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. Marguba is an honest and hardworking woman. She began a business selling fabrics, and she has been in this business for 12 years. Four times a month she travels to Dushanbe to import fabrics from Korvon Market. Marguba would like to get a loan of 5,000 somoni for purchasing new fabrics. She thanks all lenders who support her.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
P. Rano lives in Tursunzade, Tajikistan. She is married and has five children. Rano is a hardworking woman who started a business selling fabrics. She has been in this business for 17 years. She purchases her goods from Korvon market in Dushanbe. Rano would like to get a loan of 5,000 somoni for purchasing new seasonal fabrics to increase her working capital. She thanks all lenders who support her and allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: Madame Chérifatou  à 35ans. Elle est mariée à un architecte et à 03 enfants.  Elle réside à Hédzranawoé (un quartier du Togo). Elle est revendeuse de chaussures et sacs pour femmes. Elle a  débuté en 2001 son activité, fait son approvisionnement à Lomé et revend au marché de Hédzranawoé. Elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour l’achat de chaussures et sacs enfin de maximiser du profit pour participer en partie à la charge de la famille.
texts.en: Chérifatou is 35 years old. She is married to an architect and has three children. She lives in Hédzranawoé (a district of Togo). She retails women's shoes and bags. She began her business in 2001 and gets her supplies in Lomé, reselling them at the market in Hédzranawoé. She is requesting this third loan to buy shoes and bags in order to maximise her profit and make a contribution to the family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase women's shoes and bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his general store area and cover their house expenses

loans.name: Musa Ole

texts.en:
Musa Ole P. P. is 27 years old. He is married to Helen P. and they have two children. For the past five years, Musa has been a farmer and he earns a good income. He was introduced to KADET by another client. Musa is applying for his first loan of 30,000 KES to buy farm supplies and help prepare his land for planting. 

Musa is a hardworking man who struggles to achieve more. He will reinvest the anticipated profit from his loan into other businesses and pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and prepare land

loans.name: Kosiom

texts.en:
Kosiom O. S. is 33 years old and the married father of two children. For the past five years, he has been buying and selling cattle at his home and he earns a good income. Kosiom was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staffer who came to his home. He is applying for his first loan to purchase more livestock to sell. 

Kosiom will use the profits from his loan to expand his business. He dreams of becoming a famous businessman in his area and being able to provide his kids with a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Perasuna

texts.en:
Perasuna O. S. is 41 years old and married. He is blessed with three children. For the past ten years, Perasuna has been farming his piece of land and he earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. Perasuna is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies. 

Perasuna hopes to make a profit from his loan that he will use to educate his children. His dreams are to be a prosperous farmer and provide a better life for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and other essentials for farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a shop and expand her husband's business

loans.name: Saruni Ole

texts.en:
Saruni Ole Letoya M. is 24 years old. He is single and he supports his parents. For the past three years, Saruni has been a farmer. He learned about KADET LTD from marketing done by the KADET staff in his area. Saruni is applying for his first loan to purchase farm supplies. 

Saruni is an industrious man who will do well if he receives funds. He will use the returns from his loan to re-invest in farming and buy a bigger farm. Saruni’s dream is to become the best and most well-known farmer in the area.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline M. is 38 years old. She is married to Peter and they have three children aged 6, 8 and 10. For the past fifteen years, Everline has run a tailoring business. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client. Everline wants to buy a sewing machine to help her business because the one she has is not working properly. 

Everline is optimistic that her business will improve after buying a new sewing machine because she will be able to better attend to her clients. In the future, Everline hopes to be able to open up a tailoring college.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy carpets to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mosses A. Koroma's Group

texts.en:
These are the teachers of the RC Primary School in Pamlap village, which is located on the outskirts of Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. RC Primary School was built during the 1973/74 academic year by the local community with help from the Catholic Church, and has a total of fourteen staff members and 564 pupils. 

Mosses A. K. is the headmaster at the school. He was born in Yele, in the Tonkolili district in northern Sierra Leone. He is married and has eight children, three of whom are in college. Mosses has been a teacher for 45 years and is requesting a loan to pay college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay college fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Kipino Ole

texts.en:
Kipino Ole P. is 30 years old and lives in Olkinyei-Narok, Kenya. He is married and blessed with two children. Kipino also supports his two brothers who are in high school. For the past seven years, Kipino has been a maize farmer. 

Kipino learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer and this will be his first loan. He will use his loan to buy farm inputs. Kipino hopes to generate profit, buy acres of land to cultivate, and start a livestock business. He is a painstaking man who aspires to achieve more with his loan. His dream is to purchase and develop plots of land and provide a better standard of living for his children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Jeremiah Ndiro

texts.en:
Jeremiah Ndiro A. is 27 years old. He is married to Hellen Akinyi and they have three children. For the past eight years, Jeremiah has been running a motorcycle transport business (known as a Boda Boda business) in Nyatike, Migori. He earns a good income.     

Jeremiah learned about KADET LTD through a friend. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to buy another motorbike. Jeremiah will use the anticipated profit from his loan for savings and to improve his business. In the future, he plans to expand his business and provide higher education for his children.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es: L a Sra. Yngrid de 32 años de edad, Casada con el Sr. Brismak hace 8 años tienen 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar. Viven en casa propia por la  Zona norte de la ciudad de Santa Cruz. La clienta  se dedica   a la venta de abarrotes  hace 5 años. El crédito que se le otorgo  a la clienta es para la compra de  una rockola para instalarla en su tienda y así poder tener mas ingresos. La Sra. Yngrid Agradeció a la Institución por la confianza que depositaron ella, es un apersona muy trabajadora desde tempranas horas de la mañana atiende su tienda siempre amable con los clientes, con muchas ganas de superación y con deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Yngrid is 32 years old, married to Bismark for 8 years, and has 3 children, all of school age. She lives in her own house in the northern zone of the city of Santa Cruz. For the past 5 years she has sold groceries.

The loan she requests is to buy a “rockola” (“juke box”) to install in her store in order to produce more income. Yngrid is grateful to this institution for the confidence it has placed in her. She is a hard-working person, present in the store from the early hours of the morning. Yngrid always treats her customers with kindness. She has considerable drive to advance herself and to improve the quality of life of all her family.

loans.use: TO BUY A "JUKE BOX" TO INSTALL IN HER STORE FOR EXTRA INCOME

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old and is a married lady who is the mother of four children. For the past three years, she has been in the charcoal-selling business in Migori town. Nancy’s monthly profit is 10,000 KES. 

Nancy was introduced to KADET LTD by a client who is registered with KADET. She has never borrowed money from any other microfinance institution and is applying for her first loan of 10,000 KES. Nancy will use her loan to buy more charcoal to sell. She will use the anticipated profit from her loan to pay school fees for her children and to repay her loan. 

In the future, Nancy hopes to open a large charcoal store.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jose Reyneri

texts.es:
José, tiene 36 años de edad, reside en San Rafael oriente, departamento de San Miguel, su familia está conformada por su esposa  y dos hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad,  José es agricultor tiene 15 años de dedicarse a los cultivos de maíz y frijol, trabaja todos los días de la semana y está próxima la temporada donde el trabajo se intensifica por motivos de la siembra a la llegada del invierno.
Él necesita realizar las compras de los materiales agrícolas, también arrendar el terreno donde se dispone a sembrar, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le cubra estos gastos y poder llevar a cabo la siembra, ya que esta asegurándose con anticipación del terreno y de sus materiales.
Su objetivo es sacar a su familia adelante, a través del trabajo que sus hijos se formen académicamente.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and lives in east San Rafael in the department of San Miguel with his wife and two children, ages 8 and 5.  He is a farmer who has been raising corn and bean crops for 15 years.  He works every day of the week, especially now with the approach of the planting season because of winter.

José needs to buy farm supplies and pay for rental of the land he will be planting.  He is requesting a loan to cover these costs to ensure he has the land and supplies ahead of time.

His goal is to provide for his family and, through his work, make sure his children receive a good education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for land rental

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Naiyanoi Ene

texts.en:
Naiyanoi Ene M. K. is a 37-year-old married lady with six children. Three of her children are still attending school. For the past six years, Naiyanoi has been in the agriculture business.

Naiyanoi is applying for her first loan from KADET. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs. Naiyanoi hopes to generate an income with her loan that she will use to build a permanent house. In the future, Naiyanoi desires to improve her life and she hopes to see her children prosper.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Buenerge

texts.es:
Buenerge, tiene 25 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente departamento de San Miguel, vive junto a  su esposa y dos hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, él se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, tiene 10 años de estar en este oficio, trabaja todos los días de la semana, de 6:00am a 3:00pm, atendiendo cualquier actividad agrícola.
Él solicita un préstamo para  el arrendamiento de terreno, ya que debe recurrir a alquilar el terreno donde se dispone a sembrar en este año, este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir el gasto, a prepararse con anticipación para iniciar el proceso de la siembra.
Este trabajo lo realiza con mucho entusiasmo diariamente, pues de él depende su familia, ayuda a solventar las necesidades de sus hijos y que estos en un futuro sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Buenerge is 25 years old and lives in East San Rafael in the department of San Miguel with his wife and two children, ages 4 and 1.  He has been growing corn and bean crops for 10 years and works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. on all sorts of farm activities.

He is requesting a loan to pay for rental of the land he will be using this year for planting.  The loan will help pay for preparation costs for the upcoming planting process.

His work is carried out daily with much enthusiasm since his family depends on him to provide for his children and to make sure they become trained professionals.

loans.use: To pay for land rental

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Kindet Ole Kipiriro

texts.en:
Kindet Ole is 28, single, and supports five people. He lives in Narok, Kenya. He has been farming for the last four years. 

He is a humble client. He knew KADET through other clients registered with KADET in his area. This will be his first loan from KADET. He intends to use the entire loan amount to prepare the land for farming.

The anticipated profit he generates will be put back into the farm. He hopes to practice large scale farming in the future. He can do more if provided with resources.

loans.use: to prepare land for farming

loans.name: Flor Mirtaly

texts.es:
Flor, tiene 34 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es madre soltera, vive junto a su hijo de 8 años de edad, ella es empleada, como cajera de Súper Repuestos, trabaja desde el 2001, su horario es de lunes a sábado de 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en gastos escolares de su hijo, ya que debe cancelar de una sola vez el gasto del año, este préstamo le ayudara a solventar esta situación y dar la oportunidad de la educación a su hijo.
Su objetivo es realizar bien su trabajo cada día, para permanecer en esta empresa por largo tiempo, ayudando con sus ingresos a su hijo y cubriendo las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
texts.en:
Flor is 34 years old and lives in San Miguel.  She is a single mother and has an 8-year-old son.  She works as a cashier at "Súper Respuestos", where she has been employed since 2001.  Her working hours are Monday through Saturday from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to pay for her son's school expenses since payment must be made once a year.  The loan will help her resolve this situation so her son can get an education.

Her goal is to do the best she can at her job so she can continue there for a long time and provide an income for her son and cover household expenses.

loans.use: To pay for education expenses

loans.name: Jackson Musee

texts.en: Jackson is 31 years old, married and has a two-year-old child. He makes a living by running a retail shop where he sells food and other items such as cooking oil, flour and soap. He has been in this line of work for 11 years and is applying for this loan from KADET to expand his business and earn greater profits. Most of his customers live nearby, and he would like to sell them more products because this will allow him to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Gasparin Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "GASPARIN " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 8 personas en la cual todas son mujeres,  sus actividades están entre venta de comida, de bebidas,  venta de cosméticos y venta de zapatos, son de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Mery, que se dedica a la venta de comida , vendiendo en su domicilio ella tiene su casa propia  vive en ella hace 10 años , los ingresos que generan sustenta el gasto de su hogar y la educación de sus 2 hijas, con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos y abarrotes para la elaboración de sus platillos, la Sra. Eidy se dedica a la venta de productos  cosméticos por catalogo, los ingresos que generan sustenta los estudios que ella realiza en la Universidad con el dinero del crédito comprar cosmético que se encuentran en promoción para luego venderlos a un precio mas alto y tener mas utilidad , Todas las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The GASPARIN Undertaking Bank is now in its 1st loan cycle within the Institution. The bank is composed of 8 persons, all of whom are women. Their activities vary: they may sell meals, drinks,  cosmetics, or shoes. The members all live in the zone called Plan 3000,

The group was founded on the initiative of 3 members. Mery, who sells meals from her own home. She has lived there for 10 years. The income she generates provides for her household expenses and the education of her 2 children. With this loan she will buy supplies and groceries for preparing her dishes.

Eidy sells cosmetic products by catalog. The income she generates covers her studies in the university. With her loan, Eidy will purchase cosmetics currently on sale, then, sell them at a higher price to earn more profit.

All the members are grateful to the Institution for the help offered by granting the loan.

loans.use: TO BUY GROCERIES AND SUPPLIES FOR PREPARING MEALS AND FOR COSMETICS TO SELL

loans.name: Heric Hernany

texts.es:
Don Heric tiene 44 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, vive en compañía de su esposa y un hijo de 11 años de edad, quien estudia, la familia de don Heric depende de él, su negocio es la venta de tamales, elotes, atol, este nació en la familia, comenzando con poco producto, hoy día el negocio tiene un avance en sus ventas, el horario es de 9:00am a 5:00pm, teniendo 8 años de administrarlo.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de otra cocina y también materiales para preparar la venta; esta inversión le ayudara a generar más producción ya que dispondrá de otra herramienta más, para hacer más ágil el trabajo, además de que comprara materiales para la producción de su venta.
Su objetivo es ir creciendo cada día, ser más competente y poder generar un negocio auto sostenible, que garantice los ingresos necesarios para algún día comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Heric is 44 years old and lives in San Miguel together with his wife and 11 year-old son who is in school.  Heric's family depend on him.  His business is selling tamales, corn on the cob and 'atol' (a traditional, cornstarch-based hot drink).  The business was born in the family.  Heric started out without many products but his sales have increased.  He works from 9.00am to 5.00pm and has been running his business for eight years.

Heric is currently requesting a loan to buy a new stove and supplies.  This investment will help him to produce more since he will have an additional tool which will make his work smoother.

Heric's goal is to continue growing every day, to learn new skills and to be able to run a self-sustaining business which will guarantee the income he needs in order to some day buy his own home.

loans.use: to buy a stove and supplies for making his sales

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en: Jemima is 26 years old, lives in the Mahanga area of Vihiga and is married to Droban, who is a bus driver. They have two children and work very hard to provide their family with a good life. For the last five years, Jemima has made a living by running a hotel. She is applying for this loan from KADET Ltd to buy ingredients that she will use to provide good and delicious food to her customers.  She makes about KES. 5,100 a month and hopes to own a large hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to use to make meals for her hotel guests.

loans.name: Rachel Edith

texts.es:
Doña Rachel, tiene 43 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, donde administra un comedor llamado “Bendiciones de Dios”, ella vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos de 11 y 15 años de edad, este negocio lo inicio por su madre, hace 10 años, con un horario de 7:00am a 5:00pm, de lunes a domingo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para acondicionar mejor el comedor, mejorando sus paredes y volviéndolo más atractivo, esta inversión aunque no es su producción, pero si le ayudara para que sus clientes se sientan en un ambiente mejor y le visiten más a menudo.
Su objetivo es mantenerse bien en el negocio, tratar de solventar sus deudas, y ser independiente.
texts.en:
Rachel is 43 years old and lives in San Miguel where she runs an eatery called 'Benediciones de Dios' (God's Blessings).  She lives with her family: her husband and two children aged 11 and 15.  She started this business through her mother 10 years ago.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm, from Monday to Sunday.

Rachel is requesting a loan to better fit out her eatery, improving her walls and making it more attractive.  This investment will not affect her production but it will help her to make her customers feel that they are in a better environment and they will visit more often.

Rachel's goal is to keep running her business well, to try to clear her debts and to be independent.

loans.use: to improve the condition of her eatery

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James M. is 33 years old and  married to Rose who is a business lady. They live in the Bukenye area in Kakamega and they have two children aged 14 years and two years old.

James has a business selling chickens and has been in it for the past 10 years. He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD and intends to use the money to buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit. His monthly profit is KES. 7,500 that he uses to cater for his family’s basic needs. 

He hopes to venture into a dairy business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Carmen, reside en San Miguel, tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 17 y 11 años de edad, ellos son dependientes, doña Carmen administra una tienda, dicho negocio inicio con un capital de $200.00, poco a poco a medida se vende, el negocio ha ido creciendo, tiene 4 años de existir, bajo un horario de 6:00am a 7:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, surtiéndolo de aquellos productos demandados por los clientes, dando mayor fortaleza para doña Carmen, ya que de este negocio dependen los ingresos con los cuales ayuda a su esposo a llevar los gastos del hogar.
Para ella el objetivo primordial es tener un negocio más amplio, capaz de atender la demanda, que esté libre de financiamientos, para que le genere mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in San Miguel.  She is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 17 and 11, who are dependents.  Carmen administers a store, a business that she started with an initial capital investment of $200.00.  Little by little, the store has grown; it has been in existence for 4 years and runs on a schedule of 6:00 am to 7:00 pm.  

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for the business, in order to supply it with goods that are in demand by her customers.  This will give Carmen more fortitude, given that she uses the income generated by this business to help her husband support the family.  Her primary goal is to have a larger enterprise, able to meet demand and free from debt, so that it will provide her with greater benefits.

loans.use: to buy consumer goods for her store.

loans.name: Arely

texts.es:
Doña Arely, es una señora de 45 años de edad, que reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, vive con sus tres hijos de 22, 17 y 15 años, ellos dependen económicamente de ella, por su parte se dedica a la venta de tortillas, leña, bebidas refrescantes, trabaja en este negocio hace 15 años, de 8:00am a 2:00pm, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades con el negocio.
Ella necesita de un préstamo, pues quiere compra maíz, leña y dar mantenimiento a la cocina donde hace las tortillas, este será una gran ayuda para ella, pues estará abasteciendo su inventario de materiales y su principal herramienta para hacer las tortillas estará en mejores condiciones.
Su objetivo es trabajar fuerte, para ver a sus hijos formados académicamente, para luego se estabilicen en un empleo, que les garantice un mejor futuro y en condiciones diferentes.
texts.en:
Arely is a 45-year old woman who resides in the city of San Miguel.  She lives with her three children, ages 22, 17 and 15, who are financially dependent on her.  For her part, she dedicates herself to selling tortillas, firewood, and beverages.  She has been in business for 15 years, working from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm.  To date, she has had no difficulties with the business.  

She needs a loan to buy corn, firewood, and to make some repairs to the kitchen where she prepares her tortillas.  This would be a great help to her, allowing her to supply her inventory of goods and making her primary tool for preparing tortillas to operate in better condition.  Her objective is to work hard in order to see her children complete their educations, so that they can later find stable employment that guarantees them a better future and standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and maintain the kitchen where she prepares her tortillas.

loans.name: The Warriors Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento "LAS GUERRERAS " se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la Institución, compuesto por 10 personas en la cual 8 son mujeres Y 2 varones,  sus actividades están entre venta de sombreros  ropa usada, panadería y refrescos, son de la zona del Plan 3000. El grupo se fundo por la iniciativa de tres socias: La Sra. Josefina se dedica a la fabricación y venta de sombreros, viviendo así en casa propia, tiene 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando, los ingresos que generan sustentan los gastos de su hogar y asimismo con la educación de sus hijos, con el dinero del crédito comprar material para la fabricación de sombreros como adornos telas cuero, etc.  La Sra. Elvira se dedica a la venta de refresco, tiene 4 hijos y su esposo trabaja de albañil, los ingresos que generan son para el sustento de su hogar, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de azúcar por cantidad. La Sra. Carmen se dedica a la fabricación y venta de sombreros de sao(sombreros muy tradicionales de la ciudad de Santa Cruz), distribuyendo a los diferentes mercados del plan 3000 , tiene 3 hijos vive en la casa de su madre los ingresos que generan sustentan en su hogar, con el dinero del crédito comprara material para la elaboración de sombreros. Todas las socias están agradecidas con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "The Warriors" is currently on its first loan cycle with the organization. It is made up of 10 individuals, of whom 8 are women and 2 are men. Their businesses include hat sales, used clothing sales, soft drinks sales, and a bakery. They are from the Plan 3000 zone. The group was started under the initiative of three members:

Josefina crafts and sells sombrero hats. She lives in a house that is her own and she has 4 children, all of whom are in school. The income that she earns is used to cover the household expenses and to send her children to school. With the funds from this loan she will purchase materials to make sombrero hats, including decorations, fabrics, leather, etc. 

Elvira sells soft drinks. She has 4 children and her husband is a construction worker. The income that they earn is used for the support of their children. The funds from her loan will be used to purchase large quantities of sugar. 

Carmen makes and sells Sao sombrero hats (they are sombreros that are very traditional to the city of Santa Cruz). She distributes to the various markets of Plan 3000. She has 3 children and she lives in her mother's house. The income that she earns is used to support the home. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase materials to make sombrero hats.

All of the members are thankful to the organization for the support they have provided them in the form of a loan.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make sombrero hats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Marta's Group

texts.es:
Doña Marta A. G. D. M., es una señora casada, tiene 59 años D. edad, no tuvo la oportunidad D. estudiar, tiene 5 hijos, se dedica a los oficios domesticos del hogar y tambien a la crianza D. cerdos, cuenta con 3 años D. experiencia en este oficio, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo que se dedica a realizar oficios D. jornalero. 

Doña Marta deciD. orgaizar un grupo, para solicitar un préstamos que le servirá para la compra D. cerditos y alimento para los mismos,paa que cuando crezcan pueda ella venderlos y recuperarsu inversion y obtener su ganacias. Las integrantes D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como: crianza D. cerdos, crianza D. pollos y al cultivo. Esperan que con el prestamos que hacen logren mejorar sus ingresos y ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta A. G. D. M. is a married woman. She is 59 years old and she did not have the opportunity to go to school. She has 5 children and she dedicates her time to the care of the home and she also raises pigs. She has 3 years' experience in this business. She has her husband's support. He is a farm hand.

Marta decided to organize a group in order to request loans. It will help her purchase piglets and feed for them. when they have grown she offers them for sale and she recovers her investment and she obtain her profits. The members of this group have different businesses, such as: raising pigs, raising poultry, and agriculture. They hope that with this they will be able to improve their earnings and their profits.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and livestock feed

loans.name: Elberta

texts.es:
Elberta tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 8 hijos. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Triunfo II de FINCA Peru.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 3 000.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de productos como : arroz , azúcar, aceite, fideos, maíz, todo tipo de carnes, verduras y papas para la preparación de alimentos.
Elberta, está en Finca Perú ya hace 12 años, antes compartía el puesto de comida con su cuñada, gracias a sus ahorros pudo comprarse su propio puesto de venta en el mercado Carlos F. Vivanco de Ayacucho, donde vende todo tipo de caldos como : caldo de cabeza, mondongo, cordero, pata y otros platos como: arroz con pollo, tallarines , puca picante. Trabaja de lunes a domingo, gracias a Dios le va bien.
Le gusta FINCA Peru porque puede ahorrar, les enseñan y practican los valores, le orientan en la educación y cuidado de los hijos y familia.
Ahora esta ahorrando para la construcción de su casa y su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales
texts.en:
Elberta is 55 years old, married, and she has 8 children. She is a member of the communal bank named "Triunfo II" of Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner). 

She requests a loan in the amount of S/. 3000

The loan which she requests will be used to purchase products such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, pasta, corn, various types of meats, vegetables, and potatoes, used to prepare foods.

Elberta has been with Finca Peru for the past 12 years. Previously she shared a food stall with her sister-in-law. Thanks to her savings she was able to purchase a stall of her own at the market Carlos F. Vivanco de Ayacucho. She sells all types of soups there, such as: head soup, stomach soup, lamb soup, hoof soup and other dishes, including rice and chicken, pasta, and spiced potatoes. She works from Monday to Sunday and thank God she is very successful. 

She likes Finca Peru because she is able to save money, they teach and practice sound values, and they provide education on child and family care.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation

loans.name: C1909 Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Marie is 38 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 4 years old. Marie is the president of the group which is called " TWISUNGANE." In the local language that means in English " TO BE TOGETHER".  Marie is in the middle, wearing a blue sweater.   She owns a small shop where she sells different styles of men's, women's, and children's clothing.  

Marie has been engaged in this business for one year and she is currently employs one person to help her. She has her business open from 7am to 6pm every day.  Marie and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more different styles of clothes for resale to earn more income. With any extra profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy different styles of clothing in men's, women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 58 años. Vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Isaac de 59 años y con uno de sus hijos, de los 6 que tiene en total. Hace 4 años, María junto a su esposo fabrican adobe, debido a que posee tierra especial para la elaboración de adobe; desde entonces le esta yendo bien en este negocio. Una vez elaborado el adobe quemado, material que fabrica, lo hace por millares, cantidad que es vendida y le genera buenas ganancias. Ella se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, ahora para aumentar la producción ha contratado a 3 personas más, quienes son expertos en este trabajo, de esa manera fabrican más en menor tiempo. Ahora sólo se preocupa en colocar lo producido y de las ganancias pagar a sus trabajadores. Ante esto, María se intensificará en este negocio, con el tiempo espera cultivar sobre sus tierras productos y vivir de ello. Ingresa a su octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente. Asimismo está feliz de trabajar con sus compañeras de su grupo, porque son personas muy responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, pagará a sus trabajadores, para que puedan trabajar más horas y lograr cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, 58, lives in her own house with her husband, Isaac, 59, and one of her six children.  She and her husband have been manufacturing adobe for the last four years because they own special soil that is appropriate for adobe making; she has been doing well in this business since then.

Once the baked adobes are made, a production that numbers in the thousands, it is sold for good profits.  She feels satisfied with her work and in order to increase production now she’s hired three more people who are experts in the field in order to manufacture more in less time.  Her only concern now is to sell what’s been produced and to use the profits to pay her workers. In face of this, María will become stronger in the business and in time she hopes to plant crops in her fields to support herself with.

This is her 8th loan with MFP and she commits to repay on time.  She is also happy to work with her fellow group members because they are very responsible people.  She will use the requested loan to pay her workers so that they can work more hours and be able to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to pay her workmen.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is 52 and is married with three children aged between 8 and 15 years old.  He owns a small store where he sells various goods such as sugar, rice, bread and lotions.  Jean Marie Vianney has been engaged in this business for five years and he currently employs one person to help him. His business is open from 6am to 7pm every day.  

Alphonse has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy additional goods such as: lotions, braids, salt, sugar, soap and beans, etc. to sell to make a good profit. With any extra profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy more goods such as  lotions, braids, salt, sugar, soap and beans to sell.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José forma parte del banco comunal “Fénix”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna. 
El se dedica a vender frutas, verduras y abarrotes en un local que tiene ubicado en el ante jardín de su casa. José trabaja desde hace 7 años en el rubro. Su mercadería la compra en la feria de Lo Valledor, ésta es una feria para comerciantes, ya que los precios son a bajo costo, por lo tanto más conveniente económicamente. Su horario laboral es de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 23ºº horas, todos los días de la semana. 
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio, específicamente; abarrotes, verduras y frutas. Además comprará una reja para proteger su local y mejorar su infraestructura. 
Su sueño es poder ampliar su negocio y abastecerlo, además quiere comprar un vehículo que le sirva para trasladar su mercadería, ya que por ahora paga fletes para trasladarla. 
José vive con su esposa quien además le ayuda a atender el negocio cuando el no se encuentra y también prepara ensaladas.
José está muy agradecido del crédito obtenido a través de Fondo esperanza, además se siente muy contento de la organización que tiene la institución, para ayudar a personas emprendoras como él. Respecto a las capacitaciones José ha aprendido a llevar la contabilidad de su negocio.  En cuanto a las reuniones con los demás socios, estas son muy amenas y José está muy comprometido con su grupo, puesto que además es delegado del banco comunal.
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
José is a member of the “Fénix” (Phoenix) communal bank in the city of La Cisterna.  He is a fruit, vegetable and groceries merchant.  He has a store in his front yard.  He’s been in this line of work for 7 years.  He buys his merchandise at the Lo Valledor market, a market for merchants, because prices are low so it’s more convenient economically.  He works from 8am until 11pm every day of the week.

He will use the loan to stock his store, specifically with groceries, vegetables and fruit.  In addition, he will buy a metal grille to protect his locale and improve its infrastructure.  His dream is to enlarge his business and to stock it.  He also wants to buy a vehicle that he can use to transport his merchandise because at present he pays shipping costs to transport it.

José lives with his wife who helps him tend to the store when he’s absent and she also makes salads.

José is very grateful for the loan he got from Fondo Esperanza.  He’s also very happy with the organization the institution has to help enterprising people like him.  With respect to the training, José has learned how to manage his business’ accounting.  As for the meetings with his fellow members, they are quite pleasant and José is very committed to his group; he is his bank’s Delegate.

La Cisterna is a commune located in the south central sector of the metropolitan area.  It is essentially a residential and commercial commune.  At its beginning it was rural with large tracts.  However, due to its increase in population and the arrival of basic services it became 100% urban.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fruit and vegetables and also to buy a metal grille to protect his store and improve its infrastructure.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 34 años, es madre soltera con una hija de 15 años. Es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo II.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 3000.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su tienda y botica.
Miriam, es de profesión enfermera antes trabajaba en una farmacia y también vendía ropas  para tener mas ingresos. Su hermana le comento que había una tienda en alquiler y decidió  tomarla y abrir una tienda de abarrotes en general y poco a poco lo fue surtiendo. Ahora vende plásticos, aguas, gaseosas, entre otros y como había trabajado en una farmacia también abrió una botica y le va bien.
Está en Finca Perú ya hace 3 años, le gusta por las capacitaciones y talleres, que recibe y lo pone en practica en su vida diaria.
Ahora está ahorrando para tener mas capital de trabajo.
Su sueño es poder construir su casa propia con un ambiente grande para su tienda.
texts.en:
Miriam is 34 years old and she is the single mother of a 15-year old girl. She is a member of the communal bank "Triunfo II". 

She requests a loan in the amount of S/. 3000

The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to supply her convenience store and drugstore. 

Miriam is a nurse by profession. She previously worked in a pharmacy and she also sold clothing to have another income. Her sister mentioned that she had a store to rent so she decided to take it and to open her own general store. She slowly added variety. Currently she sells plastic items, bottled drinks, soft drinks, and other merchandise. And as she once worked in a pharmacy she also opened a drugstore and it has been very successful. 

She has been with Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for 3 years and she likes it for the training provided and the workshops. She puts what she learns into practice in her daily life. 

She is saving money to have more working capital. 

Her dream is to be able to build a house of her own, ready with a large space for her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to supply her store and drugstore

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en: Alphonse is 39, married and has two children who are 4 and 6 years old.  He makes a living by running a small store where he sells various items, including biscuits, lotions and braids. He has been in this business for three years and works every day from 6 a.m. to 7 p.m. With the profits made possible by this loan, Alphonse will continue to expand his business and save for his family's future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Jean Baptiste

texts.en:
Jean Baptiste is 37 and is married with two children, four and seven years old.  He earns his living as a motorbike taxi driver. Jean Baptiste currently employs one person to help him and he has been engaged in this business for four years. His business is clean. He works from 6am to 9pm every day, transporting people to their businesses. 

Jean Baptiste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy a new motorbike to help him expand. With any extra profits, he will reinvest in this business and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Rosa Inocente

texts.es:
Doña Rosa, es una señora D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Miguel, vive con su hijo D. 33 años, ella es viuda y administra una tienda, la cual atienD. hace 10 años, con un horario D. 7:00am a 6:00pm, este negocio le ayuda a solventar muchas D. sus necesidades.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería para el negocio, ya que quiere adquirir mercadería para ofrecer a los clientes y mejorar su atención.

Su objetivo es tener un negocio que le provea lo necesario, ya que por su avanzada edad, no podría atender otro tipo D. oficio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 60 year-old lady who lives in the city of San Miguel with her 33 year-old son.  She is a widow and runs a store which she has worked in for 10 years.  She works from 7.00am to 6.00pm.  The business helps her to cover many of her needs.

Rosa is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business.  She would like to acquire merchandise to sell to her customers and improve her customer service.

Rosa's goal is to have a business that provides what she needs since, owing to her age, she could not work in any other type of traD..

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ladies That Overcome Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama DAMAS QUE SE SUPERAN debido a que con el credito recibido todas sus integrantes tienen la finalidad de superarse día a día en sus negocios, principalmente haciendo una mayor inversion en sus negocios. Esta ubicado en Hidalgo, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes. La señora Delia Margarita Z., tiene 43 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, es comerciante y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida (antojitos mexicanos) desde hace 8 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en su negocio, principalmente en materia prima (maiz), y de esta forma hacerlo crecer. Al solicitar el prestamo ella se siente entusiasmada ya que en base al credito recibido piensa hacer mayor inversion en su negocio y de esta forma comenzar a tener mas ganancias que le permitan tener una mejor calidad de vida a ella y a toda su familia, debido a las altas ventas que tiene, piensa establecerse en un local que esta cerca de donde actualmente se ubica.
texts.en: This group is named Ladies that Overcome because with the loan that they receive, each of the members have the ability to excel day after day with their business. Located in Hidalgo, Mexico, this group is made up of ten members. Señora Delia Margarita Z., is 43 years old, she went to school through high school and is now a merchant, she does not have any children. Señora Delia sells food (typical mexican snacks) and has for the past eight years. She is seeking a loan to invest in her business, she will buy mainly in raw ingredients (corn) and and in this way grow her business.
