Delia is excited to apply for this loan because she sees the investment going into her business and believes that because of it she will begin to see more earnings that will permit her to have a better quality of life for her and her family. With high sales she thinks about establishing her business in a permanent location nearby.

loans.use: To invest in raw ingredients for their food business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 53 años; vive con Adolfo desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 6 de ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Tiambra. Su principal actividad económica es “la agricultura”, donde siembra desde hace 8 años papa, arveja, habas, maíz y olluco, en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, los cuales cuida con la ayuda de su esposo, quien es su compañero incondicional. Según menciona en campaña agrícola arrienda hectáreas de terrenos en el caserío de San Juan, para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades. Ya que comercializa su cosecha en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde tiene buena demanda. De igual manera prepara queso con la leche de las 3 vacas que posee, vendiendo 5 quesos diarios a un promedio de S/. 3 soles cada uno. Ahora tiene sembrado papa y habas que cosechará en el mes de mayo, con lo que espera obtener una buena ganancia para poder solventar los estudios de sus hijos menores. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa rosa de Tiambra”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde trabaja arduamente para poder mantener la unión y progreso de su asociación, como miembro de la junta directiva. María, con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que oscilan entre S/. 90 soles cada uno. Los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en:
María, 53, has lived with Adolfo for 15 years.  They have 7 children but only six of them still live with them in their own house located in the hamlet of Tiambra.  Her main economic activity is farming.  For the last 8 years she’s farmed potatoes, peas, lima beans, corn and olluco (an Andean tuber) on her own farmlands.  She cares for her crops with help from her husband who is her unconditional companion.

According to what she told us, during the planting season she leases land from third persons in the San Juan hamlet in order to plant larger amounts because she sells her crops in the city of Tarma’s wholesale market where demand is high.

She also makes cheese with milk from the three cows she owns selling on average 5 cheeses daily for 3 soles each.  She currently has potatoes and lima beans planted that will be harvested in May.  She hopes to obtain good profits to cover educational expenses of her younger children.

She’s a member of the “Santa Rosa de Tiambra” communal bank and this is her 6th loan with MFP where she works hard to maintain her group’s unity and progress as a member of its governing board.

María plans to use the requested loan to buy sacks of organic manure that run about 90 soles each that she’ll spread among her potato plants.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Aura Lidia

texts.es:
Aura, tiene 61 años de edad es originaria del departamento de Estelí, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 34 años de edad que vive y trabaja en el vecino país de Costa Rica , ella se dedica a vender productos plásticos  y mercadería en general lleva ya 30 años de ser comerciante. Empezó a los 31 años de edad a trabajar en este negocio antes ella trabajaba para una fabrica de tabaco ahí estuvo por dos años, con la liquidación que le dieron en el anterior trabajo ella comenzó a vender y comprar mercadería en general como cucharas, tazas, vasos, depósitos de basuras, platos  todos hecho a base de plástico así como vente de  ropa interior. Ella se levanta desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana de lunes a sábado para vender sus productos en las calles de los barrios de Estelí, recorre mas de ocho horas diarias caminando buscando nuevos clientes, esperando vender todos sus productos y ganarse su sustento diario de manera honrada, los días domingo ella viaja  en bus desde tempranas horas para vender en la comunidad el Regadío  la cual se encuentra localizada a 20km de Estelí. Le gustaría poder vender su mercadería  en otras comarcas el Coyolito y la Flor localizadas en los alrededores del departamento de Estelí.  
Solicita el crédito para comprar más productos plásticos como platos, cucharas, picheles, panas, vasos, coladores etc. Este crédito le será de gran ayuda pues podrá aumentar el inventario de sus productos, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, poder establecer sus negocios dentro de su vivienda, poder emplear a otras personas que le ayuden a vender.
Su meta próxima es poner piso a  su casa ya en donde ella vive no tiene, hacer un cuarto donde pueda poner su ventas de productos plásticos.
texts.en:
Aura, 61, is from Estelí Department.  She’s a single mother.  She has a 34 year old son who lives and works in the neighboring country of Costa Rica.  She sells plastic items and general merchandise.  She’s been a merchant for 30 years.  She started in this business at the age of 31.  She used to work at a tobacco factory; she was there for two years.  She used her severance pay from that job to start selling general merchandise like: spoons, cups, drinking glasses, trash cans and dishes, all made of plastic.  She also sells underwear.

She gets up very early in the morning Monday through Saturday to sell her wares throughout Estelí’s streets.  She wanders about for over 8 hours daily seeking out new customers hoping to sell out her wares and earn her daily sustenance in an honorable way.  On Sundays she takes an early bus to the community of El Regadío, which is located 20 kilometers from Estelí, to sell there.  She’d like to sell her wares in other places like El Coyolito and La Flor which are located in Estelí’s outskirts.

She is asking for the loan to buy more plastic items like: spoons, pitchers, bread baskets, drinking glasses, colanders, etc.  This loan will be of great help to her because she’ll be able to increase inventory, increase sales and improve income.

Among her future plans is being able to do some home improvements, to set up her businesses in her house and to be able to hire others to help her sell.  Her immediate goal is to install flooring in her house because it currently does not have it and to build a room in which to sell her plastics.

loans.use: to buy a variety of plastic items.

loans.name: Darling Maria

texts.es:
La joven Darling, es originaria del departamento de   Masaya localizado  a 30 minutos de la capital Managua pero vive en Estelí lleva 6 años viviendo en este departamento, ella tiene 21 años de edad , es soltera, esta estudiando su segundo año de la secundaria, se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios, vende dulces, jugos, frutas . Inicio su negocio por medio de una tía que se dedica a vender frutas y dulces en la calle central de Estelí, Darling  como cada mañana le gusta vender cerca de la calle central ya que a escasos 100 metros se encuentra un colegio donde la mayoría de los estudiantes le comprar a ella sus caramelos  por las tardes se transporta caminando con su carretón de frutas y golosinas  a vender el resto de su mercadería buscando como llevar sus sustento alimenticio diario. A ella le  gustaría  poder tener una tienda de frutas y golosinas en el mercado municipal de Estelí.
Solicito el crédito para comprar mas frutas y surtir su mercadería de dulces ya que se acerca la temporada de semana santa que es considerada una buena época de venta para el comercio. Le será de gran ayuda esta inversión pues espera aumentar sus ventas, clientela y mejorar sus ingresos para poder pagar sus estudios ella sola. Tiene como planes futuros poner un salón de belleza, pues ella estudia cosmetología los fines de semana es una actividad que disfruta mucho. Su próxima meta es terminar sus estudios en la secundaria para poder optar a una carrera universitaria pues sueña con ser una profesional emprendedora y útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Darling is originally from the Department of Masaya, which is located 30 minutes from the capital, Managua; however, for the past 6 years she has lived in the Department of Estelí.  Darling is 21 years old, single, and is in her second year of secondary school.  She makes a living selling foodstuffs, including sweets, juice, and fruit.  She started her business with the help of an aunt who makes a living selling fruit and sweets on Estelí’s central street.  Every morning Darling likes to sell her products near the central street, since it is only 100 meters from a school where most of the students buy sweets from her.  In the afternoons she takes her cart of fruit and sweets and walks around in order to sell the rest of her merchandise and thus earn her daily bread.  Darling would like to have her own fruit and sweets shop in Estelí’s municipal market.  

Darling is asking for a loan so that she can purchase more fruit and stock up on sweets, since Holy Week is approaching and that is considered an especially good time of year for business.  The loan will be of great help to her, and she hopes it will allow her to increase her sales and clientele and improve her income so that she can pay for her studies.  Darling’s plan for the future is to open a beauty salon, as she is studying cosmetology on the weekends and that is an activity she enjoys.  Her immediate goal, though, is to finish her studies in secondary school so that she can apply to a university course, since her dream is to be a professional who is both enterprising and useful to society.

loans.use: Purchasing more fruit and stocking up on sweets

loans.name: Janixi Del Fatima

texts.es:
Janixi, es una joven de 21 años de edad, es originaria del Departamento de Estelí, esta casada, es dueña de un salón de belleza que atiende ella misma, se dedica a cortar cabello y arreglar  a novias para bodas. Inicio esta actividad en su casa de habitación donde recibe con una enorme y alegre sonrisa a sus clientes   haciéndoles sentir cómodos mientras esperan ser atendidos por ella, comenzó a los 17 años de edad ya que desde entonces le gustaba embellecer a las personas, ha contado desde el inicio con el apoyo de su mama quien ha sido su mayor fuerza y la ha criado a ella solita. Anteriormente se dedicaba al comercio  venta de cosméticos y ropas que vendía junto con su mama. Aunque hoy en día vende productos de belleza y cosméticos en su salón, su esposo coopera en el hogar el trabaja despachando gasolina en la estación gasolinera.  
El crédito lo solicito para realizarle mejoras a su salón de belleza para comprar productos como  tintes, vitaminas de cabello, pintura de labios, peines, cepillos , secadoras ,planchas de cabello etc. Esto le ayudara en su negocio ya que podrá atraer mas clientes, surtir su inventario de cosméticos, tener mas herramientas de trabajo. Dentro de sus planes futuros esta tener su propia academia de belleza donde pueda dar clases y brindar empleo a otras jóvenes como ella. Su próxima meta es finalizar su carrera universitaria ya que lleva segundo año de Banca y Finanzas.
texts.en:
Janixi, is 21 years of age, she is originally from the department of Estelí. Janixi is married and is the owner of the beauty salon where she works. She cuts hair and also does hair styles for weddings. She began working in her house where she would meet her clients with an enormous and happy smile making them feel comfortable while they wait to be attended to. Janixi began when she was seventeen years old and since then she has liked embellishing people. From the outset she has counted on the support of her mother who has been her greatest strength and raised her alone. Previously Janixi sold cosmetics and clothing with her mother and even today she sells beauty products and cosmetics in her salon. Her husband contributes to the household by working as an attendant at the gas station.

The loan she has applied for is to make improvements in her beauty salon and buy products like dyes, hair vitamines, lip stick, combs, brushes, dryers hair irons, etc. This will help her with her business and may help her to attract more customers, to increase her cosmetics inventory and have more tools of the trade. Among her future plans is to have her own beauty school where she can give classes and provide employment to other young people like herself. Her next goal is to complete her university career because it includes classes on banking and finance.

loans.use: to make improvements in her beauty salon and buy products like dyes, hair vitamines, lip stick, combs, brushes, dryers hair irons, etc.

loans.name: Rudy Manuel

texts.es:
Don Rudy de 47 años de edad, es originario del municipio San Juan del rio coco,  en Estelí se dedica a reparar zapatos, esta casado, es padre de familia de 6 hijos de los cuales tiene dos a su cargo, pues los demás son independientes, sus origines humildes no le permitieron seguir estudiando solo llego hasta segundo grado de primaria no tenia los recursos económicos. Inicio esta actividad por la necesidad de trabajar, con el tiempo le fue gustando y además le da de comer a el y su familia, este a sido su único negocio, trabaja desde su casa, su esposa es profesora de una escuela primaria, se ayudan mutuamente en las tareas del hogar, pues su trabajo le permite permanecer cerca de sus dos hijos mas jóvenes que están en la secundaria. 
Solicito el crédito para comprar material de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar, componer el techo de su casa. Pues así podrá tener un hogar mas seguro mejorara las condiciones de su zapatería. Desea tener maquinas de cocer zapatos modernas y brindar un mejor servicio. Su próxima meta es aumentar sus ventas de zapatos para venderlos en diferentes tiendas y consuman productos hechos por el y sobre todo poder pagarles una buena educación a sus hijos para evitar que pasen la situación de pobreza e ignorancia que le toco vivir a el por no poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Rudy is 47 years old and from San Juan del Rio Coco, in Estelí.  His business is repairing shoes.  He is married and has 6 children.  Two of his children are still in his care and the others live independently.  Rudy's humble origins meant that he was unable to complete his education.  He only reached the second year of elementary school as he didn't have the financial means to continue.

Rudy started this business because he needed to work.  Over time he came to enjoy it and it also fed his family.  This has been Rudy's only business.  He works from home.  Rudy's wife is an elementary school teacher.  They help each other with the household chores as his work allows him to remain near his two youngest children who are in high school.

Rudy requested this loan to buy construction supplies so that he could improve the infrastructure of his home and repair his roof.  This will make his home safer and improve the conditions of his cobbler's workshop.  He would like to own modern shoe stitching machines and provide a better service to his customers.

Rudy's next goal is to increase his shoe sales so that he can sell the products he makes in different stores.  He would like to pay for a good education for his children so that they don't have to suffer the same situation of poverty and ignorance that he did due to the fact that he couldn't study.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to improve the infrastructure of his home.  To repair his roof.

loans.name: Cruz Esrmeralda

texts.es:
Cruz Esmeralda, tiene 45 años de edad, es originaria  del pueblo El Dorado localizada a 3 kilómetros de la ciudad de Estelí, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos de 22,18 y 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica a destazar cerdos es un negocio familiar en donde la apoya su esposo y sus hijos también vende verduras y frutas  en  las acera de su hogar para ayudarse con los gastos alimenticios así mismo se dedica las tareas del hogar como ama de casa ,esta criando su pequeño nieto el cual ella misma cuida mientras su hija trabaja vendiendo carne de cerdo, su labor de ella comienza desde las 4 de la mañana hasta la noche sin horario fijo , lo hace con  la fe de lograr vender los mas que pueda y tener para el alimento diario de su familia.    
Solicita el préstamo para aumentar la compra y venta de cerdo. Con este crédito aumentaría sus ingresos a través de las ventas. Su próxima meta es mejorar su vivienda, quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, comprar maquinaria moderna para destace de cerdo.
texts.en:
Cruz Esmeralda is 45 years old and from the village of El Dorado which is located 3 kilometers from the city of Estelí.  She is married and has 3 children aged 22, 18 and 4.  Cruz Esmeralda's business is butchering pigs.  This is a family business and she has the support of her husband and children.  She also sells fruit and vegetables on the sidewalk outside her home in order to help cover the family's food expenses.  In addition, she does her housework and raises her young grandson.  She looks after her grandson while her daughter works selling pork.

Cruz Esmeralda's work begins at 4.00am and she works until evening, but without fixed working hours.  She does her work with the faith that she will manage to sell as much as possible and be able to provide her family with their daily food.

Cruz Esmeralda is requesting this loan to increase her business buying pigs and selling pork.  With this loan, she will increase her income through improved sales.  Her next goal is to improve her home.  She would like to improve the infrastructure of her business and buy modern machinery for butchering pigs.

loans.use: to increase her business buying pigs and selling pork

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es originaria del departamento de Estelí, tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, ella se levanta cada mañana a vender lotería en las calles de Estelí caminando bajo un incandescente sol recorriendo los barrios  para vender sus billetes de lotería  lleva  mas de 15 años ejerciendo esta actividad de esta manera ha mantenido a sus hijos. Ella comenzó vendiendo 10 billetes de lotería y un talonario de raspaditas ahora vende un poco mas que antes saliendo a venderlos  a las oficinas y algunos clientes  fijos que le compran a ella, buscando nuevos clientes cada día para buscar vender  sus billetes de lotería.
Solicito el crédito para comprar mas billetes de  lotería y raspaditas, esto le ayudara a comprar de contado los billetes y no tener que fiarlas podrá hacer a mas clientes. Desea ahorrar para reparar su vivienda y ponerle piso a su casa. Le gustaría poder vender fuera de Estelí y conseguir un medio de transporte pues ya sus pies están cansados de tanto recorrer pero lo hace por lograr una de sus más anheladas metas que es preparar a sus hijos que están en la universidad.
texts.en:
Silvia is from the Estelí Department and is 56 years old.  She is a single mother with five children.  Each morning she rises and goes out to sell lottery tickets on the streets of Estelí.  Walking in the hot sun she walks thought the various neighborhoods to sell her tickets.  She’s been doing this for 15 years in order to support her children.  She began by selling 10 lottery tickets and a book of scratch off tickets.  Now she sells a bit more than she used to, in offices and to a few steady customers.  She looks for new customers daily.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more tickets and scratch offs.   This will help her buy to the tickets and not have to buy them on credit.  She can sell to more customers this way.  She wants to save up to make repairs to her home and add a floor.  She would like to sell outside of Estelí and acquire a means of transportation because her feet are tired after so much running around, but she continues to do it in order to accomplish one of her main goals which is preparing her children for a university education.

loans.use: to buy lottery tickets for resale

loans.name: C1910 Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Aphrodis is 29 years old. He is married and has three children, between the ages of 2 months and 5 years old. Aphrodis is the president of the group which is called " ABADAHEMUKA".  Aphrodis is wearing black. He works as a bicycle driver.  

Aphrodis has been engaged in his business for two years and he currently employs one person to help him. He operates his business from 8am to 5pm every day, except on the weekend.  Aphrodis and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy a new bicycle. With any profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: To buy a new bicycle.

loans.name: Alma Muriel

texts.es:
Alma, tiene 28 años D. edad, resiD. en la ciudad D. San Miguel, donD. vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos D. 11 y 13 años D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. tortillas, pupusas y bebidas; dicho negocio le ayuda para tener sus propios ingresos y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, su horario D. atención es D. 9:00am a 2:00pm, tiene 6 años D. estar atendiéndolo.

Ella necesita un préstamo para darle mantenimiento a la cocina donD. elabora las pupusas y tortillas,  también comprara maíz y leña, espera que poder tener un avance en el negocio, al lograr salir con esta necesidad, cree que su condición será mejor.

Tiene como objetivo mejorar el negocio, la atención y el servicio a los clientes, contando con una mejor solvencia económica para su familia.
texts.en:
Alma is 28 years old and lives in the city of San Miguel with her husband and children aged 11 and 13.  Alma's business is selling tortillas, pupusas and drinks.  The business helps her to make her own income and she helps her husband cover their household expenses.  Alma works from 9.00am to 2.00pm.  She has been running her business for six years.

Alma needs a loan so that she can do some maintenance work on the stove where she makes her pupusas and tortillas.  She will also buy corn and firewood.  She hopes that she can take a step forward in her business and get out of this difficult situation.  She believes that she will then be in a better position.

Alma's goal is to improve her business and her customer service, and to be more financially solvent for her family's sake.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood, and to do maintenance work on her stove

loans.name: Mujeres De Chimarchaj Group

texts.es:
Teodola Ediberta G. G., es soltera, tine 27 años,  estudio solamente 1 año, se dedica a la confección D. prendas y a la crianza D. animales, tiene ya 15 años D. experiencia en la crianza D. animales, inicio este oficio con 1 solo animal, y en el futuro espera tener una minigranja.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo a ASDIR y poder ampliar el capital D. trabajo que ya tiene, el prestamo será utilizado para la compra D. pollos. Las integrante D. este grupo se dedican a diversas actividades: La crianza D. anmales y la venta D. medicina. Esperan cumplir su objetivo con el préstamo que invertirán, D. mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodola Ediberta G. G. is 72 years old and single.  She only has a first graD. education and manufactures clothing and raises animals.  She has 15 years’ experience raising animals and began with a single animal.  She would like to have a small farm in the future.

She organized a group so that they could request a loan though ASDIR, which would allow her to expand her working capital.  She will use the money from this loan to buy chickens.  The members of the group have different businesses, such as raising animals and selling natural medicines.  They hope to accomplish their objectives and use the money to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Eni

texts.es: Eni, de 48 años, es una valerosa madre soltera. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Paúl y Katia, a los que cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Ana (selva central peruana). Hace 26 años que se dedica a la docencia, enseñando a leer y escribir a niños menores que estudian en un colegio estatal. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto con los niños, pues eso la relaja. Paralelo a su trabajo se dedica a la agricultura en donde siembra café, asimismo vende hielo al por mayor y menor, los cuales realiza gracias a las máquinas procesadoras que tiene. Esté negocio le brinda muchas ganancias en los meses de verano, donde hace mucho calor, llegando a vender varios kilos de hielo, obteniendo ganancias mínimas de S/. 100 nuevos soles. El servicio que hace es a los diferentes eventos sociales, como también a las tiendas, restaurantes y demás lugares donde se vende bebidas de toda variedad. La principal dificultad que tiene son los gastos de los estudios universitarios de sus hijos, a los que tiene que mandar pensiones mensuales, pues estudian en la ciudad de Huancayo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los milagros”, y este es el séptimo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece todo el apoyo que le brindaron en todo estos años. Eni, comenzará la segunda cosecha de café en sus terrenos agrícolas; por ello con el dinero solicitado invertirá para pagar el salario de los peones que le aydurán en la cosecha, asimismo invertirá en reparar las máquinas que le sirven para hacer hielo.
texts.en:
Eni is 48 years old and a single mother who lives with her two children, Paúl y Katia, whom she educates and cares for.  They live in their own home in Santa Ana (central jungle of Peru).  For the past 26 years she has been teaching children to read and write in a public school.  What she enjoys most about her work is to be in touch with the children because it helps her to relax.

Aside from her work, she also raises coffee and has ice machines and sells ice in large and small quantities.  This business generates a good income for her, minimum of S/100 PEN, during the summer months, when the weather is very hot and she sells several kg of ice.  She services various social events, stores, restaurants, and places that sell different types of drinks.

Her biggest financial challenge is that of her children’s university studies.  She must send them monthly stipends because they study in Huancayo.  She is a member of the “Los Milagros” communal bank and this will be her seventh loan through MFP.  She is grateful for the support she has gotten over the years.

Eni is about to begin her second coffee harvest and is asking for this loan so that she can hire field hands to help with the harvest.  She will also use some of the money for maintenance of her ice machines.

loans.use: to pay for field hands

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
Juliana tiene 49 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos (de edades 26,18,15,10). Pertenece al Banco Comunal Triunfo II. 
Solicita un crédito de S/. 2 000.00.
Se dedica a la venta de ropas y golosinas. 
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como : ropas y golosinas.
Juliana viaja a la feria de Iquicha los días miércoles, los jueves a la feria de Uchuraccay, a la feria de Jano los viernes y domingo a la feria de Tambo, donde vende ropa  para damas, caballeros y niños, también lo surte con la venta de golosinas. Los días que no viaja vende golosinas en el parque María Parado de Bellido.  
Ingreso al banquito por la invitación de una socia. Le gusta porque puede ahorrar.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
Juliana is 49 years old, is married and has 5 children (ages 26, 18, 15, 10).  She is a member of the “Triumfo II” communal bank.  She sells snacks and is asking for a loan of 2,000 PEN (~$725) to invest in merchandise, such as snacks and clothing.

Juliana goes to the Iquicha fair on Wednesdays, to the Uchuraccay fair on Thursdays, to the Jano fair on Fridays, and to the Tambo fair on Sundays, where she sells women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing and snacks.  She sells snacks in the María Parado de Bellido park on the days where she doesn’t travel.

She joined the communal bank after being invited.  She likes it because it gives her a chance to save some money.  She wants her children to develop professional careers and to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to increase her inventory

loans.name: Zonia Aida

texts.es:
Doña Zonia, tiene 56 años de edad, reside en la ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas y antojitos, vive en compañía de un nieto que tiene 11 años de edad.
El negocio  de ella inicio hace 10 años, vendiendo tortillas y antojitos, este negocio surge por la necesidad de disponer de dinero, su horario es de 8:00am a 4:00pm, de lunes a domingo.

Actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leña y maíz, esta compra es debido al incremento del costo del maíz, por que lo ella piensa comprar para tener la disponibilidad por un periodo.

Su plan es que con esta inversión, tenga lo necesario para producir y tener mejores ganancias, cancelando esta deuda y cubriendo las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Zonia is 56 years old and she lives in the city of San Miguel. She sells tortillas and snacks. She lives with her grandson who is 11 years old. She started her business 10 years ago, selling tortillas and snacks. The business emerged out of a need to have an income. Her work schedule is from 8am to 4pm from Monday to Sunday. 

She requests a loan to purchase firewood and corn. This purchase is needed for the increase in price of corn. She wants to buy it to have it available for some time. 

Her plan for this investment is to have what she needs to keep her business productive and to have better earnings, to pay off this loan, and to provide for the needs of the household.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and corn

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Cipriana, se dedica a atender una sala de belleza, reside en San Miguel, tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus cuatro hijos Estefani de 20 años, Gerson de 19, Luis de 17 y Carlos de 15 años de edad, ella posee una sala de belleza en su propia casa, ofrece el servicio de Cortez de cabello, tintes, limpiezas faciales, cortes de caballeros, su hija mayor le ayuda  a atender el negocio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una silla para cortes de cabello, esta compra es porque solo tiene una silla para atender a los clientes, lo cual no es suficiente para la demanda que posee, dicha compra le será de mucha ayuda para realizar el trabajo de una forma más rápida.
Su aspiración es crecer con el negocio, mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus hijos, para que se puedan superar académicamente.
texts.en:
Cipriana has a beauty salon.  She lives in San Miguel and she is 39 years old. She lives with her four children, Estafani, 20 years old, Gerson, 19 years old, Luis, 17 years old, and Carlos who is 15 years old. She has a beauty salon installed in her house. She offers hair cuts, dyes, facials, and barber services. Her eldest daughter helps her with the business. She requests a loan to purchase a barber's chair. This purchase is required because she has only one chair to serve her clients and it is not enough to meet the demand. This purchase will be a great help for her to do her work more quickly. 

Her aspiration is to make her business grow, to improve her living conditions and that of her children so that they will succeed academically.

loans.use: to purchase a barber's chair

loans.name: Manuel Natividad

texts.es:
Manuel, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, se dedica al transporte pesado de carga, vive con su esposa Griselda y su hijo de 12 años llamado Manuel, tienen casa propia.
Manuel trabaja desde joven como ayudante de padre, en el negocio de transporte pesado de materiales de construcción a bordo de camiones, actualmente está encargado de un camión y remolque en el cual transporta madera, cemento y arena. El necesita un préstamo personal, para gastos de viaje en su camión, ya que quiere viajar seguro y no cuenta con los fondos necesarios para cubrir el gasto.
Su principal objetivo es mejorar las ganancias y las condiciones para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is 38 years old and he lives in San Miguel. He works in heavy transportation. He lives with his wife Griselda and their 12-year old son, Manuel. They own their own house.  As a young man, Manuel worked as an assistant to his father in the business of heavy transportation of construction materials about trucks. He is currently in charge of one truck and a tow with which he transports lumber, cement, and sand. He needs a personal loan to cover his expenses. 

His principal objective is to improve his earnings and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the costs of travelling for his transport truck

loans.name: Sofa

texts.es: Sofa, D. 65 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive junto a su esposo Maurelio, con el que tiene 9 hijos; D. los cuales solo cría y educa a 3 D. ellos en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío D. Tiambra. DesD. niña aprendió a trabajar la tierra, cuidarla y producirla, pero cuando tenía 25 años se independizó y emprendió su propio trabajo cultivando arveja y papa, productos  que son vendidos en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma, brindándole estabilidad económica a su esposo e hijos. Paralelo a ello, Sofa elabora queso con la leche que extrae D. las 10 vacas que posee, según cuenta, todos los viernes baja a la feria que se realiza en la ciudad, para vender el queso por kilos; en ocasiones viaja a la selva central para vender el producto lácteo a un mayor precio. Ahora ella está pensando sembrar papa D. la variedad “única” y “yungay”, para poder cosechar en una buena temporada y así pagar los estudios D. sus últimos hijos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa D. Tiambra”, y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donD. agradece el apoyo recibido, en todo estos años D. arduo trabajo con su asociación. Sofa, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono D. corral (orgánico), los cuales esparcirá entre sus cultivos D. arveja.
texts.en:
Sofa is 65 years old and is a hard working woman.  She lives with her husband and has nine children, three of whom still live at home.  They live in Tiambra.  She leaned to work the land when she was a little girl, but at age 25 she started her own farming business, raising peas, potatoes, which are sold in the main Tarma market.  This helps bring economic stability to her, to her husband, and to her children.

Along with farming, Sofa also makes cheese from the milk from her 10 cows.  She tells us that she takes all of the foodstuffs to the city fair to sell by the kilogram.  Sometimes she travels to the central jungle to sell her milk products in bulk.

Now she is considering planting “única” and “yungay” potatoes to be able to harvest in a good season and be able to pay for her children’s’ educational expenses.  She is a member of the “Santa Rosa D. Tiambra” communal bank.  This will be her ninth loan through MFP, and she is grateful for the support she has gotten over the years.  She will use the money to buy sacks of organic (coral) fertilizer to spread on her pea crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 64 años y es madre soltera. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Triunfo II.
Solicita un crédito de S/. 1400.00.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en compra de prendas de vestir para surtir su mercadería.
Julia tiene un puesto de venta de prendas de vestir en el mercado 12 de abril, donde vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños, frazadas y edredones. Las prendas de vestir los trae de Lima o a veces le manda su hijo.
Está en FINCA Peru hace muchos años cuando todavía se trabajaba con dólares, ahí si tuvo dificultades por la diferencia de cambio de la moneda, pero ahora ya está mas estable porque se trabaja en soles.
Su vida ha cambiado mucho desde que esta en Finca Peru, porque se practica mucho los valores.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando hasta que Dios le de fuerzas y está ahorrando para su vejez.
texts.en:
Julia is 64 and a single mother.  She is a member of the Triunfo II community bank and is requesting a loan for 1,400 Peruvian soles.

She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying clothes to stock her business.  Julia has a stall in the '12 de abril' market.  She sells women's, men's and children's clothes, blankets and comforters.  She buys the clothes in Lima or sometimes her son sends them to her.

Julia has been with FINCA Peru for many years, since the times when they still worked in dollars because of difficulties with the exchange rate.  However, things are now more stable because they work in Peruvian soles.

Julia's life has changed a lot since she has been working with Finca Peru because values are widely promoted and practised.  Her dream is to continue working while God grants her the strength.  She is currently saving for her old age.

loans.use: to buy clothes to stock her business

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Doña Albertina, tiene 55 años de edad, reside en El Delirio departamento de San Miguel, su negocio es la venta de bebidas refrescantes, vive con su hija de 17 años. Él negocio de doña Albertina lo posee hace 10 años, su forma de vender es en los buses que se conducen a San Salvador, también distribuye en pequeñas cantidades a otras vendedoras del lugar.

Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de garrafas de agua, fardos de agua, jugos, gatorade y otros, esta compra la realizara al por mayor, obteniendo un descuento por parte de sus proveedores, esto representa para ella una gran oportunidad para recibir más ganancias y fortalecer el negocio.

Doña Albertina, tiene por objetivo trabajar por su negocio, que este competente y cubra con todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Albertina is 55 years old and she lives in El Delirio in the department of San Miguel. Her business is the sale of refreshing drinks. She lives with her 17-year old daughter. Albertina's business has been in operation for 10 years. She sells in the busses that are travel in San Salvador. She also distributes small quantities to other vendors of the area.

She needs a loan to purchase water pitchers, water barrels, juices, Gatorade brand drinks and others. She will purchase in wholesale in order to obtain a discount from her providers. This represents a great opportunity for her to increase her earnings and to strengthen her business. 

Albertina’s objective is to work at her business to keep it relevant and to provide for all of her needs.

loans.use: to purchase water pitchers, water barrels, juices, and Gatorade brand drinks.

loans.name: Jalpeñitas Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama JALPEÑITAS porque el lugar donde radican lleva por nombre Jalpa que viene del nahuatl lugar sobre arena; ubicado en Hidalgo, México. El grupo esta conformado por 10 integrantes y es la priM. vez que piden un prestamo. La señora Teresa de Jesus L. es integrante del grupo tiene 56 años de edad no tiene ningun grado de escolaridad y tiene un hijo varon. Ella vende tamales y cosmeticos desde hace 30 años solicita el prestamo para comprar de mercancia, los clientes dicen que les gusta comprar  con ella  porque las señora es muy luchona y amable con todos y cuando tienen algun problema piden su punto de vista por la experiencia que tiene. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta y con muchas ganas de trabajar, ya que solicito el prestamo para comprar más mercancia como productos de belleza y aíz para sus tamales ya que necesita los dos trabajos por que no le alcanza el con uno solo para los gastos de su familia y le hacen muchos pedidos y aveces no tiene para comprar todo. También espera con esto darle una mejor educación a su hijo ya que ella no la tuvo.
texts.en:
This group is called JALPEÑITAS because the village where the members live is called Jalpa, which comes from the Nahuatl word for 'place on sand'.  It is located in the State of Hidalgo, in Mexico.

This group has 10 members and this is the first time that they have requested a loan.  Teresa de Jesús López is a member of the group.  She is 56 years old and didn't attend school.  She has one son.  Teresa has been selling cosmetics and tamales for 30 years.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise.  Her customers say that they like to buy from her because she is very hard working and kind to everybody.  Whenever they have a problem they ask her point of view because of the experience that she has.  At the time of requesting this loan, Teresa feels very happy and has a great desire to work.  She requested this loan to buy more merchandise such as beauty products and also corn for making her tamales.  She needs both of her jobs because she can't cover her family's expenses with just the one.  Her customers make a lot of orders and sometimes she doesn't have enough money to buy everything.  Teresa hopes that she will be able to provide a better education for her son since she never received an education herself.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and corn

loans.name: Mirna Jeannette

texts.es:
Mirna, tiene 20 años de edad, reside en la Ciudad de San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y venta de comida, su familia esta conformada por sus padres, y su pequeña hija de 9 meses, vive casa que es propiedad de sus padres, ella es madre soltera.

El negocio esta ubicado en su casa, quedando cerca del hospital nacional de San Miguel, esta ubicación le permite tener más clientela, su madre le ayuda a la atención, por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería necesaria para elaborar comida y compra de bebida, boquitas y plásticos.

Con esta inversión espera mantener los niveles de mercadería para atender la demanda de los clientes, mejorando su condición de comerciante, ayudando a sus padres y a su hija principalmente.
texts.en:
Mirna is 20 years old and she lives in the city of San Miguel. She sells basic needs products and prepared foods. Her parents and her 9-month old daughter is her family. She lives at home with her parents and she is a single mother. 

Her business is installed in her house, located near the national hospital in San Miguel. This location yields more clients. Her mother helps her with the customer service. She requests a loan to purchase the merchandise she needs to prepare foods and to purchase drinks, finger foods, and plastic products. 

With this investment she will maintain the merchandise inventory she needs to meet the demand of her clients, thereby improving her business and helping her parents and daughter.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare foods and to purchase drinks and plastic products.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 66 años y vive con su esposa Antonia de 68 años, además tiene 4 hijos, que ya son mayores y no viven con él, cada uno tiene su propia familia. Los días de este trabajador hombre transcurren en la tranquilidad de los campos del caserío de Tiambra. En el amanecer de cada día; empieza su rutina de trabajo, preparando la tierra con fertilizantes naturales, sembrando las semillas que en el futuro brindarán una  buena calidad de papa, arvejas y choclos, que él aprendió a cultivar desde pequeño, aunque no tuvo la oportunidad de conocer a sus padres se crió con personas trabajadoras que le enseñaron a luchar y salir adelante. Le gusta dedicarse a la agricultura porque es el oficio con el cual ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y es lo que han aprendido a hacer  la mayoría de hombres que viven por esta parte del Perú, además lo considera muy rentable porque la calidad de papa, choclo y arveja que siembra le permiten venderlas y obtener buenas ganancias. Asimismo cría cuyes de buena raza y los comercializa en el mercado mayorista de la localidad, le gusta esta actividad porque una de sus hijas le regalo un par de ejemplares y luego vio una buena oportunidad de hacer negocio y empezó  reproducirlos. En el futuro tiene pensado sembrar más cantidad de papa, y llegar a tener una granja de cuyes. El pertenece al banco comunal “Santa rosa de Tiambra”, y este es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, y esta seguro que será responsable con cada pago, además esta muy satisfecho con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas de confianza. Ya tiene pensado invertir el crédito en fertilizantes naturales, abono orgánico, de igual manera desea comprar algunos cuyes para empezar el proyecto de su granja.
texts.en:
Concepción is 66 years old and lives with his wife, 68 year-old Antonia.  He has 4 children who are grown up and no longer live with him as they each have their own family.

This hard-working man's days are spent in the peace and tranquility of the fields of Tiambra village.  At dawn every day, Concepción starts his daily routine, preparing his land with natural fertilizers, sowing the seeds that in the future will provide him with good-quality potatoes, peas and corn which he learned to grow when he was still young.  Concepción didn't have the opportunity of knowing his parents but grew up with hard-working people who taught him how to work hard and get ahead in life.

Concepción likes to farm because this is the business through which he has managed to get his family ahead in life.  It is also the business that most men who live in this part of Peru have learned.  He considers the business to be very profitable because the quality of the potatoes, corn and peas that he sows allow him to sell them for a good profit.  Concepción also raises guinea pigs of good breed which he sells in the local wholesale market.  He likes this business because one of his daughters gave him a pair of guinea pigs as a present.  He saw a good business opportunity and began to breed them.  In the future, he plans to sow a greater quantity of potatoes and start a guinea pig farm.

Concepción is a member of the "Santa Rosa de Tiambra" community bank and this is the fourth loan that he has received from MFP.  He is certain that he will be responsible in making each loan repayment.  He is very happy with the work of his community bank because his fellow group members are trustworthy people.  Concepción plans to invest his loan in buying natural fertilizers and organic manure.  He would also like to buy some guinea pigs to start his farm project.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizers and organic manure

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 52 años, se separó de su esposo hace 17 años, producto de su relación tuvo 4 hermosos hijos. Ahora vive solo con el mayor de sus hijos Paúl, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de Santa Ana (selva central peruana). La actividad a la que se dedica es la agricultura, donde siembra en las 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, que heredó de su madre; una variedad de cítricos, entre naranja, tangüelo, así como también café, productos que comercializa en la ciudad de La Merced. Su trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo físico, ante esto debe contratar peones para que le ayuden en esta actividad. Por otro lado, trabaja como personal administrativo en un colegio del estado, trabajo que lo ha venido ejecutando durante 11 y en el hasta el momento continua percibiendo una remuneración mensual. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder estar ocupada, pues le agrada mucho ser independiente,  “Además de ayudar a mis hijos mayores en lo que ellos necesitan”, afirma. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de café en los meses de junio y julio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los milagros”, y este es el octavo crédito que tiene con MFP, donde agradece todo el apoyo que le ha brindando durante estos años. Ana, comenzará la cosecha de café; por ello con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ana, 52 years old, separated from her husband 17 years ago. She has four beautiful children from the marriage. Now she lives with the oldest, Paul, in his house which is located in the city of Santa Ana in the central Peruvian rainforest. 

She works in agriculture and plants two hectares (20,000 square meters) of agricultural land which she inherited from her mother with a variety of citrus fruits including oranges and tangelos as well as coffee, products that she sells in the city of La Merced. Her work requires a great deal of physical work so she contracts with agricultural workers to help her with the effort. At the same time she works as an administrative person at a state school, a job she has had for eleven years to the present and for which she continues receiving monthly income. What she likes most about her work is to be able to remain busy especially since she really likes being independent. "And I can help my older children with the things they need", she says. 

Now she is preparing for the coffee harvest in the months of June and July. She belongs to the communal bank Los Milagros and this is the eighth loan she has with MFP, where she is very grateful for all the assistance they have provided over the years. Ana will begin the coffee harvest and  will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of fertilizer to spread on her crops

loans.use: To buy several sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa forma parte del banco comunal “Fénix”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna.
Ella se dedica a vender y atender en su almacén, que tiene ubicado en el ante jardín de su casa. Elsa trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 12 años. Desde los cuales su negocio le ha brindado ganancias y su clientela también ha aumentado con el pasar de los años. Su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo, durante todo el día. 
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su almacén. Sus metas son organizar y ampliar su negocio, ya que el espacio que tiene su almacén en la actualidad es muy pequeño y su negocio aumenta de manera considerable. Pretende ampliar su casa y realizar un segundo piso, lo que le brindaría el espacio suficiente para agrandar su negocio. Su sueño a nivel personal es tomarse unas vacaciones, para descansar de su horario laboral. Sus motivaciones para seguir en el negocio son concretar sus proyectos.
Elsa está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza, ya que éste le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar mejores ganancias. Respecto a las reuniones estas son muy amenas y se ha generado una buena relación entre los socios del grupo. En cuanto a las capacitaciones que imparte Fondo esperanza, Elsa ha aprendido a distribuir y registrar los gastos y ganancias, generados con el negocio. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank “Fenix” that belongs to the city of La Cisterna.  She sells from and manages her store which is located in front of her house.  For the last 12 years she has been in this business from which she has earned a living, and the number of customers has increased as well.  Elsa works all day every day. 
She will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.  Her goals are to organize and enlarge her business since the space that she has is very small and her work has increased considerably.  She would like to enlarge her house and build a second floor so that she will have enough space to expand her business.  Her personal dream is to take some vacations, and to rest from her daily work.
Her motivation is to continue with the business and to carry out her projects.
Elsa is very happy and thankful for the financing from Fondo Esperanza since it allows her to invest in her business and generate better earnings.  The meetings are very pleasant and she has built up a good relationship among the members of the group.  With the training that Fondo Esperanza gives, Elsa has learned how to defer and record the expenses and earnings that she gets from the business.  La Cisterna is a community located in the south central area of Metropolitana.  It’s basically residential and commercial.  At the beginning it was a rural area with big parcels of land but because of the population growth and the arrival of services, it is now a 100% urban.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Pajalib'al Chij Group

texts.es:
Vilma Antonieta L. C., es soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, cursó los seis años de estudios primarios, se dedica al comercio de utensilios de cocina y artículos de plástico, lleva tres años de experiencia con este trabajo, inicio su negocio con un pequeño capital que tenía. 

Decide organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar su capital de trabajo, las integrantes del grupo realiza diferentes actividades productivas como: venta de utensiios de cocina, artículos de plástico y crianza de animales. Esperan mejorar sus ingresos con la inversión del prestamo que estan hacendo a ASDIR.
texts.en:
Vilma Antonieta López C., 19, is single.  She finished 6th grade.  She sells kitchen utensils and plastic items.  She has three years experience in this line of work.  She started the business with a small amount of capital she had.

She decided to organize a group to request a loan and expand working capital.  The members of the group carry out a variety of productive activities, such as: sale of kitchen utensils, sale of plastic items and raising livestock.  They hope to improve their income by investing the loan they are getting from ASDIR.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and plastic items.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: Lorenza, de 42 años; es una valerosa madre soltera que cuida de su hijo Jefferson, de 8 años de edad. Con él que vive en casa de su madre ubicada en el caserío de Tiambra. Todas las mañanas se dirige a sus terrenos agrícolas que heredó de sus padres en el caserío de Chacapampa, donde siembra desde hace 9 años: papa y arveja. Pero según cuenta la extensión de su terreno agrícola es muy pequeña tanto así que a veces alquila otros terrenos agrícolas para poder sembrar en mayores cantidades. Pues tiene que trabajar con ahínco para poder cubrir los estudios de su pequeño hijo al que le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo libre. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la tranquilidad que  le proporciona estar en el campo. “Cuando viajo a la ciudad de Tarma, para comercializar mis cosechas me aturde el ruido de los autos”, menciona. Ahora ella se está preparando para la cosecha de papa de la variedad “yungay” y “única”, que sembró hace algunos meses. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santa rosa de Tiambra”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe para el trabajo que realiza en cada campaña agrícola.  Lorenza con el crédito solicitado comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Lorenza, 42, is a brave single mother who cares for her son, Jefferson, 8.  She lives with him in her mother’s house located in Tiambra hamlet.  She heads out to the fields she inherited from her parents every morning in Chacapampa hamlet where she’s farmed potatoes and peas for the last 9 years.  But, according to what she tells us, the size of her field is small so she also leases other fields in order to plant in greater amounts because she has to work very diligently to cover her son’s educational expenses; she dedicates most of her spare time to him.

What she enjoys the most about her work is the tranquility working in the countryside entails.  “When I travel to the city of Tarma to sell my crops the noise from the traffic befuddles me," she mentions.  Now she is preparing to harvest the “Yungay” and “Única” variety of potatoes that she planted a few months ago.

She is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Tiambra” communal bank and this is the sixth loan with MFP where she is grateful for the support she gets for the work she puts into each planting season.  Lorenza will use the requested loan to buy several sacks of organic manure to spread among her fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Apec-Al Ouma Dieupeul 4 Groupe 2

texts.fr:
La cellule de Dieupeul 4 est un groupement qui est subdivisé en plusieurs sous groupes dont celui du groupe 2. La cellule  est affiliée a l’association Al Ouma. 
Apec Al Ouma groupe 2 est composée de 9 membres qui ont la particularité d’habiter ensemble. Ils sont représentés par madame Barro B. présidente de la cellule(elle accompagne les membres du sous groupe comme elle est la présidente de leur cellule mais n'a pas bénéficié de ce prêt,c'est la femme qui a la main levée sur la photo) et monsieur Birane B. président du sous groupe( vêtu d'une chemise beige sur la photo). Les membres du sous groupe se sont réunis dans le but de mettre en place un local abritant la vente de cannette et de savon dans leur quartier. Le sous groupe est  membre du guichet de Liberté 6 depuis novembre 2010. Pour démarrer leur activité ils ont l’intention de déposer une caution dans une société de savonnerie et de distribution de canette dans l’objectif de s’approvisionner en produits.
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 
 
Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

NB.sur la photo figurent 9 personnes car c'est la prisidente de cellule qui a accompagné les 8 bénéficiaires du sous groupe, elle  se trouve a droite de la photo habilée en grand boubou.
texts.en:
The Dieupeul 4 cell is a group which is divided into several sub-groups, one of which is group 2. The cell is affiliated to the Al Ouma association. Apec Al Ouma Group 2 is made up of nine members who have the peculiarity of living together. They are represented by Mrs. Barro B., who is president of the cell (she appears in the photo with the group members since she is president of the cell, but did not take part in this loan) and Mr. Birane B., who is president of the sub-group (he is wearing a beige shirt in the photo). The members of the sub-group got together with the aim of putting in place premises to provide a base for selling canned drinks and soaps in their neighborhood. The sub-group has been a member of the Liberté 6 branch since November 2010. In order to begin their business, they plan to make a deposit with a soap company and a can distributor with the objective of getting some stock. 

Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit organisation, whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas), Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children. They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.
 
Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in USD 2 per week. Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

NB. There are nine people on the photo since the president of the cell is with the eight beneficiaries of the group; she is on the right of the photo wearing a large "boubou".

loans.use: déposer une caution dans une société de distribution de savons et de canettes.

loans.name: Gloria Del Rosario

texts.es: Gloria Del Rosario de 45 años, vive con su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos en el barrio Maria Auxiliadora. Ella posee su negocio ubicado de manera ambulante, en donde vende ropa para damas, caballeros, niños y público en general. Tiene clientela pues tiene variedad de mercadería y siempre satisface a todas las personas que la visitan, estar a la orden del cliente es su lema. Gloria quiere ver crecer su negocio y es así como se decidió solicitar un crédito que le permita comprar más mercadería como pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes, shorts y trajes de baño pues se acerca la temporada de verano. Gloria tiene muchos sueños y confía que su negocio le ayudara a salir adelante para así lograr una vida plena junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria Del Rosario is 45 years old and lives with her life partner and three children in Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood.  She owns a business which she does not run from a fixed location.  Gloria sells clothes for women, men, children and the general public.  She has customers because she offers a variety of merchandise and always satisfies everybody who visits her business.  To be at the customer's disposal is her motto.

Gloria would like to see her business grow and so she has decided to take out a loan which will allow her to buy more merchandise such as pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts and swimsuits since the summer season is approaching.  Gloria has many dreams and she is certain that her business will help her to get ahead so that she can enjoy a full life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, shorts and swimsuits since the summer season is approaching

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: La Familia Renacer 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group La Familia Renacer (The Family is Reborn)1 & 2, and her story is representative of the members of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. 

Ana´s group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santiago, a city known for its tobacco production, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her three children. She enjoys attending church to sing and to preach.

Ana is excited to be taking out her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a colmado, or small general store, by stocking rice, beans, cooking oil, spaghetti, sauces, canned products and flour. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business.  She wants to have an improved business in order to reach her dream of one day opening a supermarket and having enough money to travel to Jerusalem. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, spaghetti, sauces, canned products and flour

loans.name: Clara

texts.es: Clara, de 31 años vive con su esposo Juan, y sus 4 hijos, en la vivienda de sus suegros, ubicado en la ciudad de Tarma, donde sus hijos tienen mayores oportunidades académicas. Su habilidad hacen que cada cosecha se comercialice de manera rápida y a buen precio, pues es una de las mejores productoras de papa, por eso los mayoristas ya la conocen y le compran debido a la calidad de sus productos que es incomparable a las demás productores de papa. Lleva 14 años dedicada a la agricultura, y junto a su esposo cada se intensifican en la siembra de papa de la variedad “yungay”, “única” y de diferentes colores, pues cada color tiene otro sabor. Llo que más le gusta es ofrecer sus productos en el mercado central de Tarma  y  en la ciudad de La Merced, que pertenece a la selva peruana, donde vende el tubérculo por menudeo, por kilos. Ella se considera una mujer de negocio, por eso en adelante planea tener una tienda de comestibles que construirá en el interior de su casa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los sanjuanitos de hacienda huay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde reafirma que le gusta laborar con los integrantes de su banco comunal, porque son personas unidas y responsables. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fertilizantes naturales y abono orgánico para asegurar su producción.
texts.en:
Clara, 31, lives with her husband, Juan, and their four children in her in-laws’ house located in the city of Tarma where her children’s educational opportunities are better.  

Her skills insure that each of her harvests is sold quickly and at a good price because she’s one of the best potato producers and wholesalers know her and buy from her thanks to the quality of her products which is superior to the other potato producers.

She’s been farming for 14 years and, together with her husband she concentrates on farming “Yungay” and “Única” varieties of potato in various colors because each color represents a different flavor.

What she enjoys the most is selling her products in Tarma’s market and in the city of La Merced, which is part of the Peruvian jungle, where she sells the tuber at retail by the kilogram. She considers herself a businesswoman and plans in the future to have a grocery store she’ll build in the interior of her house.

She is a member of the “Los Sanjuanes de Hacienda Huay” communal bank and this is the fifth loan with MFP where she reaffirms that she enjoys working with the members of her communal bank because they are united and responsible people.  She will use the requested loan to buy natural fertilizer and organic manure to assure production.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Fátima De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Fátima es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 29 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 6 años. Ella inicio con la venta de nacatamales y fue recogiendo fondos y trayendo por encargo de poco en poco.
Ella tiene dos hijos de 11 y 13 años por quienes trabaja arduamente, e invertirá el crédito en mercadería de temporada.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fátima, 29, is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman who’s been selling clothes for the last 6 years.  She started out selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) and gradually amassed funds and started filling orders little by little.

She has two children who are 11 and 13 years of age for whom she works arduously.  She will use the loan to buy seasonal merchandise.

loans.use: to buy summer seasonal clothes.

loans.name: G.s. Los Pescaditos Group

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria tiene 4 hijos, dos de los cuales están estudiando en primaria y uno ya trabaja ayudándole en su negocio. Ella ya tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la actividad de vender mariscos, los cuales los compra en Casares y los sale a vender en diferentes zonas. Ella desea este crédito con el objetivo de comprar más mercaderías. El mayor obstáculo que enfrenta es cuando se escasea el producto haciendo que incremente el precio. Su sueño es hacer más grande el negocio y llegar a construir un acopio entre los integrantes de este grupo, Antolina Estebana es la otra integrante tiene 46 años. Tiene 2 hijos, uno de los cuales ya tienen19 años y le ayuda en el negocio. Su actividad es la venta de mariscos, que ha sido de herencia de sus padres, quienes le enseñaron a comerciar el producto ya que ha vivido allí toda la vida. Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pescado, chuletas, camarones, punches, pardo, guicho entre otros tipo de mariscos. El mayor obstáculo que enfrenta es principalmente de salud ya que padece de la presión y muchas veces la afecta, teniendo que dejar a cargo del negocio a su hijo. Su sueño es realizar la compra de una camioneta para poder movilizarse con la mercadería de una manera más fácil y económica.
texts.en:
Ana María has four children: two are in elementary school and one already works helping her with her business.  She’s been selling seafood for 20 years.  She buys it in Casares and sells it in several areas.  She wants this loan to buy more merchandise.

The greatest challenge she faces is when product is scarce and prices rise.  Her dream is to enlarge the business to such an extent as to become a gathering center among the members of this group.

Antolina Estebana is the other member.  She is 46 years old.  She has two children one of whom is 19 years old and helps her in the business.  She sells seafood, a line of work inherited from her parents who taught her to sell this product since she’s lived there her entire life.

She requested the loan to buy a variety of sea food items.  Her greatest obstacle is her health because she has high blood pressure and often it affects her and she has to leave her son in charge of the business.  Her dream is to buy a pick-up truck to transport her merchandise more easily and more economically.

loans.use: to buy seafood.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Doña mercedes, de 57 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vive con sus nietas e hijas, trabajan juntas, las tortillas las distribuye en el mercado municipal, todos los días de la semana.
Ella actualmente necesita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, ya que sus compras las realiza por medidas grandes, lo que permitirá tener un mejor precio, ahorrando un porcentaje.
Su objetivo principal es construir su propia casa, donde llevarse a su familia y vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 57 years old and lives in San Miguel.  Her business is selling tortillas.  She lives with her granddaughters and daughters.  They work together and distribute their tortillas in the town market every day of the week.

Mercedes currently needs a loan to buy corn and firewood.  She will make bulk purchases which will allow her to obtain a better price and save a percentage.

Mercedes' main goal is to build her own home for her family and to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Monte Fresco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Monte Fresco lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras; una de ellas es la señora Reyna Isabel A. de 37 años madre de 5 niños de 20, 13, 7, 5 años y un bebe de 9 meses. 
Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa con la ayuda de su hijo mayor e invertirá el crédito en mercadería 
Las otras integrantes son Marizol F. Mendosa de 38 años quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita y Norma Andino Torrez  de 33 años es propietaria de una pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
The “Monte Fresco” group has three hard working, dedicated entrepreneurs.  One of them is Mrs. Reyna Isabel A., 37.  She is the mother of five children who are 20, 13, 7 and 5 years old and a 9 month old baby.  She sells clothes with help from her oldest son and will use the loan to buy merchandise.

The other members are Marizol F. Mendosa, 38, who has a “fritanga” (fast-food eatery serving fried food) and Norma Andino Torrez, 33, who owns a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Margarita De Jesus

texts.es:
Margarita, tiene 29 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, es madre soltera, trabaja haciendo tortillas para vender, de esta manera se gana el dinero para alimentar a sus hijos, su labor inicia de 7:00am hasta terminar lo pedido.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar maíz, ya que está encareciendo, por lo que ella quiere aprovechar para comprar por cantidad mayor y tenerlo guardado.  
Ella trabaja por cuidar a sus hijos, darles lo necesario y algún día compra su propia casa.
texts.en:
Margarita is 29 years old and lives in San Miguel.  She has two children aged 6 and 3.  She is a single mother.

Margarita works making tortillas to sell.  In this way she earns the money she needs to feed her children.  She starts working at 7.00am and works until she has finished making what has been ordered.

Margarita is currently requesting a loan to buy corn since it is becoming expensive and she would like to take advantage and buy a large quantity to keep in stock.

Margarita works to take care of her children, to provide them with what they need and, some day, to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn

loans.name: Valezka

texts.es:
La señora Valezka Tessalia Gutiérrez Riva de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella se dedica al comercio de ropa y zapatos desde hace cinco años en el cual invertirá el crédito.
Gutiérrez inicio en Adim con crédito solidario la fue graduada a crédito individual.
texts.en: Valezka is 31 years old and is a hard-working, enterprising woman. She has made a living selling clothes and shoes for the past five years and plans to invest the loan in more merchandise. She started out with a group loan and has moved on to an individual loan.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es:
La señora Luz Adilia S. Herrera es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella desde hace 12 años inicio vendiendo licor actualmente tiene un bar bien surtido. 
Ella con el crédito renovara su permisos de operaciones que año con año se renuevan.
texts.en: Luz is a hard-working, enterprising woman. She started out selling liquor 12 years ago and now has a well-stocked bar. She plans to use the loan to renew her licenses, which she must do year after year.

loans.use: to renew her liquor licenses

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 45 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, es padre de tres hijos de 14, 15 y 18 años, quienes viven con él y su madre, don José se dedica a la venta de artesanía, minutas en carretón y ruedas (juegos mecánicos), está enfocado en andar en ferias de los pueblos comunales.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, para las artesanías y minutas, con esta compra está garantizando una mejor estabilidad al negocio.
Su aspiración es tener acceso a más carretones de minutas, administrar otro negocio, aumentado sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 45 years old and lives in San Miguel.  He is the father of three children aged 14, 15 and 18.  His children live with him and their mother.  José's business is selling handicrafts, snow cones from a cart and fairground rides.  He concentrates on going to village markets.

José is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, for his handicrafts and snow cones.  This purchase will guarantee him better stability for his business.

José's aspirations are to have access to more snow cone carts, to run another business and to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica  Argentina L. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita como pollo, carne asada, enchiladas, tajadas…etc.
Ella tiene cuatro hijos de 16, 12, 10 y 6 años respectivamente, y  con el crédito piensa mejorar su vivienda el cual tiene malas condiciones el techo de su casa.
texts.en: Verónica is a hard-working, enterprising woman who has a popular restaurant selling fried foods such as chicken, steak, enchiladas, plantains, etc. She has four children, ages 16, 12, 10 and 6, respectively. She plans to use the loan to make improvements to her home, which has a roof in poor condition.

loans.use: to make home improvements

loans.name: Maria Nelis

texts.es:
María, reside en San Miguel, es soltera, tiene 32 años de edad, vive con sus padres, se dedica a la venta de ropa,  esta mercadería la vende en los pueblos cercanos, trabaja de 8:00am a 4:00pm, todos los días.
Ella necesita de un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir, ya que este negocio debe tener movimiento en cuando a lo que ofrece, porque las modas cambian y los colores de igual manera, con esta inversión espera satisfacer las demandas de los clientes y contar con su preferencia.
Para el futuro tiene como meta compra su propia casa, instalar su negocio y hacer su propia familia.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old, single, and lives in San Miguel with her parents.  Her business is selling clothes.  She sells her merchandise in neighboring villages.  She works from 8.00am to 4.00pm every day

María needs a loan to buy clothes since this business needs movement in terms of what is sold because fashions and colors change.  With this investment, she hopes to meet her customers' demands and be able to count on their loyalty.

In the future, María's goal is to buy her own home, to set up her business there and to have a family of her own.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Las Gemelas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Gemelas está conformado por Mariela R., Carla B. y Martha R.. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora R. de 23 años quien se dedica a la venta de mercadería variada (ropa, perfumes, shampu, zapatos, platos etc.) el cual inicio con 2,000 cordobas actualmente invierte más ya que su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Ella con el crédito piensa además de invertir en su negocio con la compra de mercaderia poner una venta de comida los fines de semana (sopa y fritanga) y la venta de frutas diario (papaya, melon, sandia, madarina, mango...etc).

Las otras integrantes doña Carla de 32 años vende ropa usada y Martha de 30 años vende ropa, perfumes etc.
texts.en:
The "Las Gemelas" ("The Twins") group consists of Mariela R., Carla B. and Martha R.. The group's coordinator is Mariela, 23, who makes a living selling general supplies (clothing, perfumes, shampoo, shoes, plates, etc.), a business she started with 2,000 cordobas (roughly $90). Now she plans to invest more into her business since it has been growing. 

With this loan she would like to further invest in her business by buying merchandise that would allow her to sell food on the weekends (soup and fried food) and the daily sale of fruit (papaya, cantaloupe, watermelon, mandarin, mango, etc).

The other members of the group are Carla, 32, who sells used clothing, and Martha, 30, who sells clothing, perfumes and other items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shoes, perfumes, clothing, shampoo and plates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and butter

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es:
El grupo Arco Iris lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Ana Martínez Rivas, Rosa M. y Carmen Martínez. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Martínez Rivas de 61 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 5 años.
Ella invertirá el crédito en mercadería para aumentar su negocio.
Las otras integrantes doña M. vende productos Avon y ropa interior y Carmen Martínez de 48 años comercializa perfumes, chinelas, ropa…etc. de todo un poco.
texts.en: The Arco Iris group consists of three hard-working and enterprising women: Ana, Rosa and Carmen. The group's coordinator is Ana, 61, who has made a living selling clothes for the past five years. She plans to use the loan to purchase more merchandise to expand her business. Rosa sells undergarments and Avon product, while Carmen, 48, sells perfumes, slippers, clothing and a little bit of everything.
