loans.name: Dioleta

texts.en:
Dioleta S. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental.  She is 31 years old. Dioleta is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Dioleta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, coconuts and green bananas in the local community. Dioleta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dioleta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Dioleta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Dioleta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and green bananas. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Dioleta from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods and green bananas

loans.name: Bernandita

texts.en:
Bernandita A. is from the village of San Francisco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 63 years old, widowed and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Bernandita owns and operates a specialized retail store selling several type of dried fish in the local community. Bernandita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Bernandita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Bernandita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of dried fish. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish

To make a living, Sherly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Sherly has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Sherly joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Sherly is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as canned goods and beverages. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Mayramkul

texts.en:
Mayramkul U. is 44, married, and has five children. Along with her husband, she has been engaged in breeding cattle since 1990. This is the only mean of subsistence for their family. They started with the initial capital of 8.000 KGS. Today, they earn about 1.000 KGS in a month from selling milk products.  With the revenues, Mayramkul was able to pay for education for her children and to hold her son’s wedding.  

At the present time, Mayramkul's farm amounts to one milk cow and four goats and still needs to be developed. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 50.000 KGS to purchase cattle.  It will allow her to broaden her business and to increase her sales of meat products. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Proserfina

texts.en:
Proserfina A. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 61 years old and separated from her spouse. To make a living, Proserfina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. Proserfina has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Proserfina joined Kiva partner, HSPFI ,to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Proserfina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products such as snack foods and canned goods. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI

In 2009, Yvunette Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Yvunette Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Yvunette Ann is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the second loan taken out by Yvunette Ann from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

texts.en:
Irish E. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 21 years old. Irish is single and has one infant child.

In 2010, Irish joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Irish has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI.

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita G. is from the village of San Francisco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Pablita is married and has six adult children. 

To make a living, Pablita buys and sells bananas and coconuts for copra (coconut meat for making oil) in the local community. Pablita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Pablita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Pablita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Pablita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green bananas and coconuts for copras. This will be the third loan taken out by Pablita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional green bananas and coconuts for copra

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen B. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 57 years old. Helen is married and has 10 adult children. 

To make a living, Helen owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap and beverages. Helen has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy T. D. is 45 years old with two children who are at vocational school. 

Being a farmer, she focuses on growing rice and vegetables to meet her family food demands. Besides, she breeds 200 chickens for eggs. Her business is quite good and it creates a considerable income for her to pay for her family expenses and school fees. 

Since joining our credit program in 2003, she has had a good history of repayment. Now she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy food for her chickens and to improve their house.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and improve  their house

loans.name: C1241 Abakundumurimo Group

texts.en:
Leopord is 50 years old, married and has seven children, aged between 7 and 23 years old. Leopord is the president of this group, which is called "ABAKUNDUMURIMO" in local language, which means in English "TO LIKE A JOB."  He is in the middle, first line.   

He owns a small business where he sells different products such as beans and Irish potatoes.

Leopord has been engaged in this business for five years and he currently employs two people to help him. He runs his business from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. every day. 

Leopord and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy more products such as beans and Irish potatoes for resale to get better profits. With any profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell such as beans and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Geronedes

texts.en:
Geronedes C. is from the village of San Francisco, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Geronedes is married. 

To make a living, Geronedes buys and sells green bananas and coconuts for copra (coconut meat used for making oil). Geronedes has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Geronedes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Geronedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Geronedes is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts. This will be the second loan taken out by Geronedes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Meshack Sen'gete

texts.en:
Meshack Sen'gete K., aged 37 years, is married to Elizabeth Mulele and together they have one child, Bridget, aged four years and in nursery school. They live in Eastleigh. 

Meshach runs a shop at Machakos town. He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer in charge of the Eastlands office.

Meshack has been running this business for  two years and it gives him a  monthly profit of KES 15,000.

This loan of KES 15,000 is his first loan with KADET, and he plans to use it to buy more cooking oil, sugar, flour, tea leaves and cellular airtime cards.

If the loan boosts his business, he plans to increase his stocks and buy more food. 

Meshach hopes to open a wholesale shop some day. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: to increase stocks of fat, sugar, flour, tea leaves and cellular airtime cards

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne P. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old. Marianne is married and has five young children. 

To make a living, Marianne buys and sells bananas, like lakatan, kantong and kardava, and sweet potatoes in the local community. Marianne has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marianne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Marianne has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Marianne is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas and sweet potatoes. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marianne from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new car and cover house expenses

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 29 years old and is married with one child who is one year old.  He owns a small store where he sells various goods, such as juices, biscuits and lotions.  He has been engaged in this business for three years and he currently employs three people to help him. He opens his business from 7am to 8pm every day except on Saturday.  

Jean Bosco has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy additional goods, such as soap, braids, salt, sugar and beans, etc., to sell for a good profit. With any profits, he will reinvest in his business and save for the future.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell, like soap, salt, beans, etc.

loans.name: Melanita

texts.en:
Melanita P. is from the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Melanita is separated from her spouse and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, buying and selling bananas and coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Melanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 26 years old and is married with two children, ages 1 and 6 years old. Her business is well-organized and she sells sacks of sorghum for making local soft drinks.  She employs two people to help her. Her business operates from 6am until 7pm every day except on the weekend. She has two year`s experience in this business.

Pelagie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sacks of sorghum to sell. With any profits, she will expand her business and she will be able to save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of sorghum to sell

loans.name: Selly Cherop

texts.en:
Selly Cherop K. is a lady of forty-eight years old, married to Jairus and together they have four children. She buys milk and sells to her customers in Eldoret market. She has been in this business for two years and gets a monthly income of about $24.

This will be Selly's third loan from KADET LTD, and she has repaid her other loans successfully. She plans to use the entire loan to increase her stock by buying more milk to sell.


She will use the income she will get to educate her children. In future she desires to open another milk shop.

loans.use: to add  stock of milk for sale

loans.name: C6307 Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Edmond is 29 years old and is single. He is the representative of a group which is called "Dufatanye" in the local language. Edmond owns a small shop which sells green bananas and he has four years of experience in the business. He employs two persons in his business as helpers so that his business will run well.

Edmond and his group has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more green bananas for the purpose of earning more profits. With the profits, they expect to improve their businesses. Eduard, in particular, needs a fridge which will allow him to create a new business of selling cold soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase more green bananas to sell.
